Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: bbfgator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at DBR from 9/2-9/9...what started out as a fiasco, ended up nicely. This was a timeshare exchange for us...this was "girls" week. Upon checking in, I learned that Interval had made an error and cancelled our stay..long story but no need to go there. After being introduced to the Operations Manager, John Betros, and being told we had no reservation and he was at 100% capacity...I thought well I guess I'll be driving back to Jacksonville...only 2 hours away but big disappointment for the "girls". Mr. Betros took it upon himself and spent the time to rectify the problem. We were able to stay in a 1BR the first night (there were only 2 of us at that time) and the next day we were able to move into a 2BR lockoff so everyone had plenty of space. Both units 601 and 702/a were nicely appointed and clean. But the management and staff had no idea how they helped me...you see my mom (83) has some health issues and I am the caregiver...I needed this time away so thank you DBR for making it happen for us! The staff everywhere was always friendly...even the burger from the Tiki Bar was very good. Easy access to the beach and being after Labor Day the crowds were gone and it was just a great overall experience. This resort wants you to have a good stay - we were there for down time and relaxing on the beach so we really didn't use the amenities so can't comment on that. Give this place a chance, they aim to please :).

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose but far from resort quality...”
Reviews.Author: RachelM2012
Reviews.Content: We booked an 8 night stay at DBR in February. I requested early check-in (knowing that our flight was going to be in earlier than 3pm) and also requested oceanfront view. Of course "not guaranteed", but they said they would take our request into consideration & "it shouldn't be a problem". When we arrived at 11:15, we were told our room wasn't available but they would call our cell when ready. Sounding as if it would be a short period. At 2:30, we still hadn't received a call so we went back to the resort and when I approached the front desk to inquire about our room..the girl just shook her head (no) & said "not ready yet". We proceeded to wait in the lobby until 3:45 before our room was ready! (not pleased!) Upon entering the room, we found it was very spacious and the beds (not the pull-out) were VERY comfortable. The pull-out was impossible to sleep on. The fully equipped kitchen was nice especially since we were staying so long, we had planned to have breakfast & some lunches in the room. The room itself, on a "cleaning" scale, was a 3/10. The baseboard & vents were disgusting-see for yourself. We arrived on Saturday and by Thursday, we still had no cleaning service in our room. I ended up speaking with the GM (regarding another issue) and he advised they don't offer cleaning daily, it's 'suppose' to be after 4 days (clearly it was longer than 4 days). Our view from the balcony was the hotel next door & their dumpsters. During our stay, we found out this is a timeshare place, so don't expect an oceanfront room unless you own a timeshare at this resort. The pool was fantastic & very clean and the Tiki Bar was awesome!! (Make sure you take care of Mike & Amanda in there!!) One afternoon, the 'security' guard approached me while I was laying out at the pool and asked where my wrist-band was. I proceeded to take it out of my camera bag & put it under my hand (as I didn't want a tan line around my wrist). He said that I needed to WEAR it, that putting it under my hand wasn't sufficient and proceeded to say "I would hate to throw you out of the pool area for not putting the band on". I said the band was UNDER MY HAND & he could CLEARLY SEE IT!! He walked away and came back about a half hour later and said he checked with management and they said that having it under my hand was fine. (Good-because if I'm paying to stay at your resort for 8 days, I don't need to be tagged like an animal!!) He said they were having problems with 'beach-goers' coming up and accessing the pool...maybe they should fix their magnetic gates & only people that have room keys would be able to access their pool?? Seems that would be a good suggestion! Even after talking with the GM and expressing my concerns regarding the pool incident and the cleaning service, we wouldn't be back to this resort. It served the purpose as we were basically only in our room to sleep, but not the quality we had hoped for and anticipated after reading reviews.

Reviews.Title: “great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are exceptionally large and if you add the lock- out unit it's great for large family's, or grandma and grampa can come along too. The lock-out units have small kitchens and a whirlpool tub bedside. The main unit has a living room and full kitchen with dining table and couch(which sleeps two). The staff always has something special for the kids to do, and there is always something scheduled for the adults and teenagers. The pool is a little hard to swim in because of the current from the slide water gushing into the pool . There is an ocean front cabanna bar, hot tub,and plenty of lounge chairs. The staff at this resort for the most part are very accommodating. There is also an inside pool and hot tub in case of bad weather. Easy walking to shops and restaurants at the Ocean Walk and along A1A.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DandRWolfe
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Sept 1st at the wee hour of the morning. We were able to get a nice north facing room, 2 bedroom lock off. I think they're still working on renovations, but the rooms were nice all the same. Comfy beds, nice kitchen area and spacious. People talk about the bird droppings on the balcony, well I think it's no fault of the resort. We went out on the balcony one night and there stood a pigeon on the light fixture. He was determined to stay. We tried to shoo him away with a cardboard but it didn't phase him. The staff have no problem coming to clean your area. You just have to call. The tiki bar is pretty nice. Drinks are a little pricey, but no more than being on a cruise. My husband says he would change the bar and have some "roll up" walls installed which would make it nice. It would make it look more open to the deck. Nice idea I think. We are still here. We check out on the 6th, but we've had a great time so far. No complaints. We would come back :)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angel06071
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many places along the East Coast. This place is by far the BEST even compared to five star locations. The staff could not have been more accomodating. The General Manager John Betros was personable and professional. It was evident that his staff respected him, their jobs, and were completely happy. I have never been to a location where EVERYONE is so friendly and personable. This truly was one big happy family. I have stayed at fancier locations but none compare to our experience at the Daytona Beach Regency. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: JRJR09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Daytona Beach Regency 8/2-8/5 for my first trip to Daytona Beach, FL and it was absolutely amazing. I was very pleased with my room, which was very spacious. The entire suite was extremely large and cozy; the full kitchen was equipped with all the appliances and cookware you would need to feel like you were at home. I felt just like I was at home and didn't need to do anything but grocery shop. Everything was very clean and organized. The king size bed was so soft and plush; very comfortable!!! There was plenty of bath towels, washcloths, hand towels, and pool towels (very nice & big). The sofa bed was comfortable as well. There were flat screens in the bedroom and living area; nice central a/c unit (I NEVER HAD TO COMPLAIN ABOUT ANYTHING). Everything worked the entire time. Overall, I would definitely be going back to stay longer and would recommend it to anyone that hasn't been to Daytona Beach before. There is more than you could imagine available to you here for adults and children from the tiki bar, arcade, children activities, outdoor sports on the beach, indoor bar, computers, wireless internet, cable w/ HBO, DVD/VHS players, radio, indoor and outdoor pools and jacuzzis, etc. It was just wonderful and my family and I are surely going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: berlinfan82
Reviews.Content: Ran over to Daytona Beach for a day from Orlando with the family and got a two bedroom for the night. Very spacious and well appointed. Nice pool area with easy access to the beach. Steel drum band by the pool area was nice that night. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Looking forward to the next visit. This a timeshare property, more than likely you will end up with a view of the hotel next door as I'm sure the ocean facing rooms are taken by the members.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't.....”
Reviews.Author: MinkieWoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency from 7/22 -7/27/12. The room itself was well appointed with a full, well-equipped kitchen, thick towels in the bathroom, and a comfy bed. Fortunately, we had a northern view, and the view from the large windows in the bedroom was beautiful! Four complaints: 1) Bird droppings on the balcony. I notified the staff, and they came up, but only did a minimal job cleaning the droppings. There was no way anyone would want to sit in either chair even after the cleaning. 2) The cleaning staff did not clean around our toilet, and it smelled of urine. We notified the front desk, and they sent deodorizing spray. It did not help. 3) Our room was not cleaned the entire time we were there. We were told our room would be cleaned on Wednesday. Didn't happen. We had to call the front desk and ask for towels just to get a shower before 6 PM. 4) The pool and pool area were FILTHY. The pool was being cleaned on Monday morning, 7/23. When we left, the pool area had not been touched again, other than trash cans were emptied. The pool had scum around the tiles, diaper crystals (the crystals disposable diapers have in them to absorb moisture), bird feathers, and bugs adorning it. The sand was not washed off at the beach showers during this entire time. On a good note: 1) The Tiki Bar was SUPER! The staff was friendly, and the food was delicious! 2) The fitness center was very well appointed. 3) The underground, gated parking was safe and secure. Overall, I probably would not stay here again, for the money/points, unless I knew that the above mentioned issues were worked on. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelaround_8
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, it was a very pleasant stay. The only I did not enjoy was the uncontrollable RAIN during my stay. Please check the weather forecast before booking somewhere! Highly recommend that part. Ok back to the hotel, receptionists are very nice and helpful. Due to the weather, the staff offered a variety of activities for children, as well as, adults. I do have to admit that this is the hotel for families with children. They have an indoor pool and spa, fitness center, and game room. There are vending machines for small accommodation such as detergent, sunscreen, floss, and medication. There is also a small lounge for parents to relax a bit and surf the net. The great outdoors involve a pool with a water slide and a jacuzzi. Of course there is a beautiful sandy beach right pass the gates. There are plenty of lounge chairs for you to relax and read a book. The tiki bar is also located outside too. The room was wonderful and comfortable. It was very "home-like" with a flat screen TV in the living room and DVD player ( I think there's a blue-ray player too). The couch is a pull-out bed for your extra guests. The kitchenette is stocked with tableware and household utensils (plates, cups, bowls, pots, etc) I think it is a good idea to stop by a grocery store and stock up on food, more cost efficent since the rooms as everything you need to cook. The bedroom has a king size bed and another flat screen in the room, and an IPOD dock to charge your IPhone. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was intense with pressure. They have small bottles of toiletries for your convenience and extra toilet paper and towels as well. The bathroom is also spacious. I absolutely love this hotel! Everything is located perfectly such as the boardwalk, the beach, and many other dining places!

Reviews.Title: “Fifth Year At this location”
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: Once again, the location provided excellent service, spotless accomodations, and plenty of activities. We come for the beach and seafood, but the Tiki Hut is an excellent place to stop when you are coming back in for lunch, or for the day. The food is great and the drinks are outstanding. We highly recommend this hotel. It is small, so you don't get the impersonal service. The team here cares how well your vacation is going and will do anything to make it a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: kimberly w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, unfortunately had a south side room, a view of the dumpsters...was disapointed in that, I felt we had booked the room early enough to get the northside. The room was nice, we had a 2 br/2 bath clean, great linens and towels. Liked the location also, great staff...I would stay again, just not the southside view.

Reviews.Title: “Always disappointed--but not here:)”
Reviews.Author: PamWisc
Reviews.Content: The reviews here are correct, an excellent location and terrific apartment. Knowing about south side views of dumpsters, when the clerk said that was to be my room, I asked if anything on the north side would be available tomorrow and she said another room, 501, would be available in a few hours (it was 1pm.) If you look at the building from the front, this 'room' is the entire space!! Living room on south side with city view and bedroom at the opposite end. You can lay on the king size bed and see the ocean...ah. The deck is on the bedroom north side and while it is noisy and close to traffic, the sliding door does keep the sound out. The beach is great, the drinks are fine and quick service at the tiki bar, the food is just average, the pool area is clean and never a problem finding a chair. There is an ihop across the street and a Walgreens a block and a half away for bread, milk, beer, etc. Many other restaurants a block or two away. I can be picky and have traveled all over the world, from mom and pop hotels to $$ chains. This was just terrific. The people, the place and the location. Thank you Daytona Regency for making this a special vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I just returned from a week's stay at the Regency. Bottom line, we will be back. We stayed in a spacious 2 bedroom suite on the 5th floor on the north side of the building. We had a wonderful side ocean view, and could also see some of the 'action' on the street. The room was very, very clean and well appointed. Everything in room room is high quality and worked great. The Cuisinart coffee maker was awesome. Three LCD tv's made everyone happy as well. Be sure to tip the housekeeping staff. All of the the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. At the front desk, Thse (I hope the spelling is correct) helped us find the perfect room, and Diane gave us several helpful tips and info. The food at the pool bar is very good and reasonable. The smoked Mahi-Mahi dip is very good. The burgers are big and good. Philly cheesesteak is also good. The bartender in the pool bar cooks your food right there so it is very fresh. The drinks are good but not enough booze for my taste, but the Voodoo drink was decent. Most of the time we took our own beer, and bought a drink or two. The bartenders work their butts off and are nice and friendly. Be sure to take care of them. The location is perfect. The boardwalk begins at the next resort. Ocean Walk is a 3 minute walk, which has a 10 screen cinema, several restaurants, and shops. Mai Tai Bar has a great happy hour specials, and you can sit outside like you are on your own patio overlooking the ocean. We heard Sloppy Joes and Wing House are good, but did not make it there (yet). Daytona Beach has got its act together. The have a large part of the beach looking good. We will return to the Regency every chance we get. I hope your experience is as good as ours.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: NayiNorthfield
Reviews.Content: It was my husband and my second honeymoon. Celebrating 25 years together! Four children take up all our time and THIS was d only couple's vacation we had taken in 17 years of marriage. We were dumbfounded by the courtesy, comfort and luxury we experienced. The tiki bar was priced extremely reasonably and the drinks and foods were DELICIOUS! We did NOT want to leave. This hotel is spectacular in every way. The ONLY thing I would improve is that the paint on the railings should be updated, but that's all. EVERYTHING else was PERFECT! 5 STARS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay..........”
Reviews.Author: eagle167
Reviews.Content: We stayed in April and had an Ocean Front Room- what a treat- I've never stayed right on the Ocean before- and found it incredible! We went to the Walmart( 20 minute drive) and bought groceries for the week- that was nice to have as some days we didnt leave the beach/pool area till 4pm and with small kids, dinner is shortly thereafter. We used the bbq's down on the deck- They were spotless! Very impressed! I found the balcony on the 4th floor incredibly windy- so heads up. We werent able to sit on the balcony in the evening because of this- I highly recommend using it first thing in the morning. Although the beach was incredible and the resort was great I dont think we'll be back to Daytona- There really isnt much to do from playing/relaxing in the ocean/pool area. I found Atlantic Avenue extremely dirty and unkept. Minimal shopping except for the same souvenir shops over and over again. If you need a holiday JUST to sit by the ocean and rest- this is for you- otherwise I suggest a 1-2 day visit and then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: suzsmith40
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this facility! We booked a two bedroom suite. We ended up with a nice ocean "view". We requested ocean front but I am not sure how you go about truly getting one of those rooms. We were on 5th floor which was constantly being bothered by nesting pigeons. They had babies in our vent on the patio which was NOT fun dodging them flocking and pooping all over the place. I would encourage a room higher up to avoid the pigeon issues. There were no housekeeping issues. The front desk was very accommodating. The activities were great as well. We will be back but would love to know the secret to get that ocean front room! It was another great visit.. .Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “TWO BEDROOM SUITE DUMPSTER VIEW”
Reviews.Author: ladyscorpion30
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed that we rented the two room suite for two nights via bookit that was suppost to be OCEANFRONT view as my family whom haven't experienced the ocean and we received dumpster view of the adjacent motel, significant other and myself are frequently in daytona for weekends and can see the dumpster in any other area!! Our rooms were never freshened and the customer service from the front desk was in the toliet, very rude and demeaning, and when a concern was brought to there attention of the fold out bed being broken no offer was given to have it fixed, so sleeping on a broken bed and were very uncomfortable. VERY VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place & Even Better Employees!!!”
Reviews.Author: CodyMaughan
Reviews.Content: Rooms were huge and the service from the employees was beyond amazing! Stopped randomly in Daytona and the host gave me a room for very cheap and from the time I walked in until the time my luggage was in the room was no more than 10minutes! If you're looking for a place to respect you as long as your respect them then this is the place to be! I've never met a more hopeful group of people as far as hotels go!

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Regency”
Reviews.Author: Charles P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency for one week in early March 2012. We expected to find some Spring Break activity but didn't expect to also find Bike (Motorcycle) Week as well. We had a great time. The hotel was booked solid but handled everything very well. The hotel is very well located right on the beach within a couple of blocks of the main street where much of the bike week activities took place. We were able to park our car for free and walk anywhere we wished to go in the downtown area. Our one bedroom unit was large and overlooked the pool and the ocean. The room did not have washers and dryers in the unit but there was a free washer and dryer on the floor. The fitness center is small and could have used one fewer machines but we never found it crowded. The pool area is ample and the bar/snackshop at the pool, with waiter service around the pool, was nice to have. You walked out a back gate from the pool to the beach which, despite being in Spring Break and Bike Week, was never crowded. A very family frinedly hotel and setting.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms -- took forever for room to be ready”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums it up. This was one of the finest rooms we've ever stayed in, space wise. Loved the layout. They basically gave us a larger one bedroom suite with a kitchen and joined it with a one bedroom suite with a kitchenette to make one huge room for us and the two kids. We ended up hosting 12 for Easter dinner, and everybody was comfortable and enjoyed watching the Masters with us. The room was maybe 800 sq feet? Wish they could guarantee oceanfront, but they don't. That was one minor "minus". We had a few of the laundry loading area for the Wyndham, the city, and a sliver of the ocean. Still, that was OK and we enjoyed the ocean breeze. Not the end of the world because the room was great. The price was great! Now for the negative, the front desk lady was very nice, but we did show up at the (later than usual, we think) 4 p.m. checkin -- right on time -- and were told our room would be a "few minutes". It wasn't ready until about 5:15 p.m., maybe even 5:30 p.m.--didn't check the clock but it was well past 5. That rubbed me the wrong way. See, I was supposed to initial that I would be out by 10 a.m. (which is a tad early, I think) and the room checkin was 4 p.m. (which is later than most places) and I STILL had to wait with our two toddlers for more than an hour to get in the room? Need to hire more cleaning staff or something. They knew they had whiffed, too, because they made a little "i'm sorry" goodie basket for us and the kids, which was nice. Anyway ... I was fuming at check-in, and ready to go 3 or maybe even as low as a 2 on the rating. But the place was outstanding, the pool side area was a blast, and the proximity to the bandshell and the pier and everything in that area was great. Parking was easy too. I think our experience was an exception more than a rule. We'd try it again, no doubt. Oh, and also -- I slept better here than 95 percent of other hotels I stay at, and hey ... gotta mention it ... NO WEIRD SMELLS! Gotta love that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Tiki Bar!”
Reviews.Author: tim t
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the hotel, but did spend a few hours on the pool deck enjoying the tiki bar. Great service, both from the two bartenders and our cocktail server. Fun environment, good view too. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “From DISASTER to DIVINE”
Reviews.Author: AuntieGenius
Reviews.Content: Disaster: we opened the door to our 2 BR suite and were hit with a wall of stench that none of us could identify, at the same time, my nephew slipped on the wet tile and landed in the wet carpet. Not a good first impression -right? The hotel staff went out of their way trying to address and solve the issue. Unfortunately, we had to remain in the room for one night - with the doors open until we could be moved to another suite in the morning. (I need to tell you that in the middle of the mayhem I posted an earlier review in haste and in the heat of the moment so this is actually my amended review of our stay.) Through it all, the staff was super friendly and apologetic and determined to make us comfortable. We asked to be moved to another suite in the morning, and they happily agreed and gave us another suite with a nicer view of the north part of the beach. The pool is fabulous, the corkscrew slide is a blast, and if they had a bed in the pool bar, that's where we would have stayed. You can't beat the location, the congeniality of the staff, and we will DEFINITELY return next year. Lesson learned: speak up, give people a chance to resolve the issue, and relax....you're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: crudd49
Reviews.Content: We chose DBR for our spring vacation and I got a little worried after reading some of the reviews. I loved it. Our room was great we had 10th floor room and it was one back from Ocean Front so we had a great view from our balcony. The room did have a slight used odor to it when we arrived, but when we went to grocery store I picked up a 99 cent odor absorber and it fixed the problem by the next time we came back to the room. The pool and hot tub were nice and we thoroughly enjoyed the water slide. The indoor pool was down when we visited 3/4-3/7 which was a bummer. The concierge was great, hotel had a lot of events going on. Overall this resort was exactly what I had hoped for. The outdoors could use a little paint but the rooms were great. Only recommendation is that they get a new queen mattress. -Kitchen was fully stocked, -Bath was beautiful -Two flat screen tv's -Ihome -Dvd player -Walking Distance to most things Overall probably one of the best places I have stayed at wish I had the money to go back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain with quality.”
Reviews.Author: 5redsox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week in February. The rooms were very spacious. We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, dining room, kitchen, another small kitchenette for the second bedroom, living room, free laundry facilities and ocean view. Front desk was great. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. We were told they would call us as soon as it available. We went to lunch and to my surprise they really did call and said we were good to go. Nice pool deck area with tiki bar right on the beach. Close walk to boardwalk( not much to see there). Considering how inexpensive it was I wasn't expecting much. I was more than pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for just one night to see a Jerry Seinfeld show at the Peabody Auditorium. Once we saw our room, we wished we had more than one night to spend here. Our room was huge, extremely clean, full kitchen, separate bedroom, living room, large spacious bathroom, and 2 balconies!!!! All for a bargain price, it was not what we had expected for the $80 price tag, and hope to come back with our children in the future. The staff was very friendly and helpful, free parking, superb location. Right on the beach, within walking distance to many restaurants, the boardwalk, and where we saw Jerry Seinfeld. Thank you Regency for a wonderful experience. We will definitely be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Goldieharley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regency because it is walking distance to Oceanwalk which has restaurants, theatre, bars and shops. We spent all day outside and barely any time in the room - there is so much to do. I felt comfortable having our teenage sons walk around on their own. They had a blast playing volleyball, going to the movies, renting beach bikes and more. We never needed a car which is great. The rooms were very nice. We would definately go back to the Regency. It is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Clean and well located to conference center”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: Booking a hotel from across the world can be daunting the photos can often be misleading. Not in this case. On arrival the staff were extremely polite and helpful and explained everything. Up the lift I go still wondering and curious as to my accommodation quality then I opened the door to a huge 1 bed room fully serviced (kitchenette) unit.WOW were my first thoughts and all for an internet special of $79 per night for 3 nights. Americans are used to this style and quality of accommodation but from Australia all I can say WOW. Incredible internet value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our 7-day stay”
Reviews.Author: klutzWestBend
Reviews.Content: We were glad that they honored our request to be on the north side and on 9th floor--we had a great view. The 2 bedroom lockout was perfect for us and our friends. We were disappointed that the pool area was being renovated. Restaurants like Ba Ba Gump's, Sloppy Joe's and IHOP were within a block. A nice Publix was within a mile. It is just on the north end of the boardwalk--very nice. The staff went out of their way to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. You are near many restaurants, an excellent walking beach(hard packed) and a short bus ride from a grocery store and many clothing stores. If you can get a good price (80$ or so) it's hard to imagine a better place. Rooms are quiet, spacious with full kitchens. 20$ cab ride from the airport and very possible to stay here without renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Space and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Nonna-Papa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property with our daughter and her three young children, on two occasions as we traveled during the holidays. We reserved a two bedroom apartment for both stays. We found the apartment to be clean, very spacious, comfortable, and well equipped with everything we would need during our short time there. The first stay provided us with an apartment on the 8th floor, overlooking the parking lot and front entrance, but because of the vacant lot next to the hotel, we had a good view of the ocean and beach from our balcony. Unfortunately, for our second stay, we were given an apartment on the second floor, looking at, and situated above the dumpsters of the hotel next door. When we asked to be moved, we were told this wasn't a possibility, so the noise from emptying the dumpsters was our alarm clock in the morning! The hotel's location provides many different eating and shopping options, as well as an entertainment pier withing walking distance. Our stays were too short to visit the amusement area, although I'm sure this is something the children would have loved to do. The hotel's location on the beach, and the adjacent pool area, caused us a delay in the morning, as we planned to leave during our first stay, because the children (and my husband) "accidentally" got caught in the surf, and finished off (since they were already wet) in the pool!!! But their shouts of pleasure certainly made up for the few minutes it took to dry their clothes in the dryer located on each floor of the hotel. I hope we can make another drive through Daytona Beach, so we can stay at the Regency again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a "heartbeat".”
Reviews.Author: fasteddy1954
Reviews.Content: We flew into Daytonna Airport which is a short trip to and from our resort by taxi. They were resurfacing the parking lot when we arrived and was still working on it when we left. This property is very well maintained, and all the staff are friendly. I had read other reviews and heard how friendly the staff were, and they are absolutely right. From the front desk persons, to the conceirge staff, and the hotel security, they all acknowledged us in the hallways and were alway greeting us from the front desk on arriving or leaving the hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which faced the resurfaced parking lot and we could also see the ocean from our room. The rooms were very clean, and the beds were very comfortable and the linens in excellent shape. The Tiki Hut was a welcome addition to the hotel, and we ate lunch there several days, good snacks, and drinks. The ocean is just a short distance from their outdoor pool which made it nice to go to and from the ocean and to the pool area. It was nice to see the hotel making improvements and when we were there they were installing new lighting in the center of the main lobby area. The complaint of slow elevators was not an inconvenience at all, and the wait did not seem overly long at all...and since we were on vacation, we weren't looking for any speed elevators. Also the smell that I noticed was more of a usual hotel cleaner... and it certainly wasn't a bad smell at all...but more of a typical hotel smell. I was surprised at the amount of eating places and places to buy groceries in close proximity of our resort...all in walking distance. I was surprised at the size of the other resorts close to ours, ours being so much smaller, but definately worth the stay. The empty lot next to ours appeared to be cleaned and the sign says it has been sold. I would stay here at the Regency ....in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: vaca21
Reviews.Content: This is right on the beach and within walking distance of the many restaurants, clubs and the boardwalk and shops. The rooms are nice size and comfortable. Views of the ocean from all rooms even though the south side is very close to the hotel next door and you need to look out to the ocean rather than across to the parking garage and trash containers. Rent a bike from the guys on the beach, $10/hr great riding on the beach ! Would definitly return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Daytona Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: This is a review of our annual trip to Daytona. This year we brought a couple of family members with us. We stayed in a two beedroom suite. The original suite was ocean front (2nd floor), but had a leak in the AC that flooded the lock-out. We had to move, but were moved up to a higher floor on the North side of the building. This was much better than the second floor location. The move was very easy, with excellent help from the staff. As usual the rooms were clean, the hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly, attentive, and willing to help your every need. Access to the beach is excellent. Located in a no-drive portion of the beach. Easy walking distance to all the attractions.... Can't wait until next year.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: brad b
Reviews.Content: Our group chose the Regency for Biketoberfest 2011 and were very happy with our choice...The room was very clean,the staff was on top of everything and the location was perfect.We were on the 2nd floor facing the ocean.The only complaint was that they dont have daily housekeeping but other than that we will definetly return

Reviews.Title: “"Great Daytona Beach Location"”
Reviews.Author: mallarduck
Reviews.Content: The Regency is a pretty nice hotel to stay right on Daytona Beach. The room we had on the 7th floor faced South toward the hotel next door, about 60 feet away, with a nice balcony and a sideways view of the beach. Our king bed was very comfortable, two nice tv's and free wi-fi. The upper floors of the hotel are recommended for your stay, as the lower ones seem to pick up much more traffic noise and even the garbage trucks servicing the hotel next door. A limited number or rooms directly face the beach at a higher cost. Super nice folks checked us in and out at the front desk. Parking is below the hotel in mostly tight quarters, but doable for free parking right at the beach. We were allowed a second vehicle to park with no problem in September. Pretty nice pool and hot tub near the beach. Great location on the beach, with several resturants within a block or so. Great evening country music singer at the outdoor bar. We were invited to take the time share presentation at checkin, and it was okay with a nice payoff for 90 minutes of listening. Rented the room via a price special on Orbitz.. Would return again if the price remains favorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with condo feel”
Reviews.Author: Jodi W
Reviews.Content: After much searching, I picked this hotel because it had a kitchen. Was pleasantly surprised it had a full kitchen with all the cooking utensils and pans you needed. Bed was comfy with nice soft linen and pillows in bedroom. Cant say much about the couch pull out bed. Had to ask for linens for that and put blanket under sheets to soften it a bit. Hotel was clean. No complaints about that. If your staying for less than a week, you have to hunt down the cleaning staff to get new towels, coffee refills and necessities because they only come once a week. Can also get from the desk if you ask and know to ask. All the staff was very friendly. Nice pool with slide but very bad current in it due to the slide. Almost lost my mother because of it and her not being able to swim well. Just be careful with little kids. Nice bar at pool. A little pricey for the drinks but overall not that bad. Right on the beach. Elevator was really slow. Parking underneath the hotel was free and very convenient. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They almost managed to ruin our entire vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Tivy06
Reviews.Content: When my family and I, including my mother, decided to go on vacation this year we searched far and wide to find the perfect accommodations to suit our needs. We wanted a 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. We had stayed at the DBR on one other occasion in 2005 and were pleased with our stay, even though they were doing remodeling at the time and it could be very noisy. We made our reservations 2 months before leaving and made the reservations through the hotel website due to the fact that we had 1 special request; we asked that our room be on no higher than the 4th floor (there are issues with heights and elevators). When we finally found our way in (still being remodeled 6 years later and the front is not clearly marked) and checked-in we were informed our room was not only above the 4th floor but they had managed to put us the 9th floor (there are only 11) and that we didn't get the room we wanted because we didn't check-in earlier. First of all, we checked in at 5 p.m. so it wasn't long after the time we were suppose to check-in. Second, we had a reservation for 2 months and they knew about the request at that time. We had in no way given any sort of impression that we were not going to show up so why was it so difficult to insure there was a room available on one of the floors we had indicated ready for us just because of the time we checked in. When we were informed of this we immediately let the desk clerk know this simply would not be acceptable. The clerk told us that they would gladly move us to another room when one became available in 2-3 days. Our stay was only 6 days and that would mean we would have to unpack, go get groceries and tolerate going up and down stairs or tolerate long elevator trips, repack and unpack again. This was absolutely crazy to ask of someone, in my opinion. It wasn't until we told them that since we did not find this "solution" acceptable and wanted a full refund on our stay that they managed to work out something where we could get a room on a lower level the next day. We were still not happy but it was better than having to search for a new place after we had already gotten there. We felt like prisoners that first night because 9 floors is entirely too many stairs to climb, the elevator ride was too long and we couldn't even enjoy our balcony because every time I walked out my knees would get weak. The rooms were nice but the cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired. The grout in the shower in the main room was completely black from mold and the jet tub, in the second room, had mold in the jets (I could only imagine what else was in there if there was mold). I went out and bought a bottle of bleach spray and a scrub brush to clean the shower and tub with and spent a good 2 hours of our vacation cleaning just so I could feel clean after a shower. All I have to say is "Never again!" Never again will my family nor I subject themselves to this form of stress at the hands of this hotel. This was our one family vacation for the year (which we haven't had in several years) and a lot of it was spent very stressed out over something that should have NEVER been an issue in the first place. Here's hoping if you decide to stay there your stay is a lot better than ours! Also if you are a laptop user and want to use the internet make sure you have a smart phone that is internet capable for your computer. The internet is so slow that my computer would usually time out before a web page would load. There was nothing high speed about their internet and from what I could tell they only had one small wireless router with a weak signal for the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler020
Reviews.Content: Me, my mom, and my 19 year old daughter stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency the last few days in July. We received excellent service from the hotel concierge and staff and everyone was very friendly. We loved our room and we were amazed at how spacious it was. The bed was comfortable, there were lots of pillows, the sheets were soft, and the pull out couch worked out fine for my daughter. The bathroom was huge with LOTS of mirrors so we all had space to put on makeup. The appliances worked well and the coffee was good. We loved the easy access to the beach and the guitar player who sang in the evenings by the Tiki Hut. The pool looked inviting and everyone seemed to have a good time. It was worth what we paid for it and I would definitely return to this hotel if I come back to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “awesome vacation cant wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: lions61
Reviews.Content: Daytona beach regancy and its staff have to be one of the best on Daytona Beach.The locattion is great, the property is clean, and the staff awesome! We had a two bedroom lockout unit, there was six of us! The unit was large, comfortable, and most importantly spotless!! The staff at the front desk were extremely helpfull and prompt if you needed anything you got it now! The pool area and tiki bar were great as well, the activities and the DJ at the pool just added to what myself and my family would say was the best vacation we have ever had on Daytona Beach! Thanks to The Daytona Beach Regency and the entire staff for a awesome time.

Reviews.Title: “"Even better than the last time!"”
Reviews.Author: cdburrus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency two years in a row now, and this year was even better than the last! The staff was friendly, the room was great, and the resort itself felt like a second home. It's sized just right as to not me overwhelmed, and it's convenient to everything. We would definitely go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We go here every year. And we love it...”
Reviews.Author: MOMMYHUNTA
Reviews.Content: Every year my family and I go to Daytona Beach for our Vacation we always stay at the Daytona Beach Regency.. It is a beautiful Vacation spot just a short walking distance to the Daytona Beach Peir, Movies, Dining, Water Park and its right on the beach. We love this Resort. They are very kid friendly, they have live entertainment on the weekends and they always have activities for the kids to join in on. If your planning a family vacation or just a nice getaway i would suggest this Resort to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Nice timeshare”
Reviews.Author: h2ofreeze
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week as a family getaway in a two-bedroom (#1004) which was a one bedroom with an attached lockout (#1004A). The rooms were clean, neat, and were set up nicely. The view was to the south, directly at the building next to us, but the beach was visible from the balcony and windows. The view down was the service alley for the next building, and frequently we could hear them unloading trucks and dumping trash, but we could also hear kids splashing and squealing in the kids pool of the nextdoor property. No view of our building's pool or beach area, though. The single lockout had a two-burner stove, no oven, bar sink, undercounter fridge (didn't use it); the bedroom had a queen bed with the roman style jacuzzi tub next to it. Bathroom was ample, with a shower only, but lots of cabinet space. The closet was rather small, as it also housed the air handler, and the hangers hit the doors when they were opened/closed. The one-bedroom suite had a queen bed, larger closet (which also housed the air handler), and a bit more spacious feel. The bathroom was a bit smaller, and had a shower only. Kitchen was sufficiently appointed, full-size refrigerator/freezer, dishwasher, microwave, 4-burner stove and oven, lots of cabinet space; small dining table was a bit akward with a column in the way, and the living room was spacious and comfortable. The balcony was off of the living room. We saw pigeons on the balcony on occasion, but no messes. Flat screen TV in each bedroom and living room. Kitchen had service for six. Air conditioning worked very well, but the air handlers in the closets made for really noticing when it turned on and off. Undercounter fridge in walkout was noisy; when I mentioned this to the front desk, they replaced it with a new unit that was very quiet. Had a problem with one of the televisions; they sent a maintenance person right away and the issue was fixed. As we are earlybirds, we went to bed early, and I could hear each firetruck, motorcycle, pimped-out car, and partier who drove by on A1A for some time. Under-building parking was nice to keep the car from baking in the sun, but the long wait for elevators was at times annoying. Nice to be able to enjoy the beach without the cars driving by. Pool was enjoyable (a bit salty, noticed many kids wearing goggles). Far enough away from the constant noise of the pier, but close enough to enjoy the restaurants, shopping within a short trip. A nice facility, friendly staff, maintained well.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and will return next year!”
Reviews.Author: djcpbr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always check TA for reviews before we go to a hotel/ resort and were a little concerned by a couple of the reviews for the DB Regency. After staying for the week of May 22-29, I am pleased to report that we loved it! Our 2 bedroom suite was on the 8th floor and was very nice. It was clean and nicely updated in terms of decor and furnishings and amenities. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and the resort itself (while small - not a bad thing!) was overall very nice. It has a good fitness center, which I used every morning. One of the nice things about the fitness center is that it had restrooms, water, towels and antiseptic wipes to use on all the machines (how rare is that?!?), as well as a flat screen TV to watch. Music was also piped in to exercise along to. The resort only has 11 floors (which is what I mean by small), and is next door to a very large and nice Wyndham Ocean Watch, but by comparison, the Regency was just great, with no long waits for elevators or crowds. I would recommend you ask for a room on the north side (if you can't get ocean front), as the views from this side are nicer (the Wyndham blocks some of the views from the south side) They also have a nice little game room, with a foosball and pool table, as well as electronic games (we didn't use this, but nice to know it's there), and offer some activities for kids evidently. They also have a concierge, who is just that (not a thinly veiled timeshare salesperson), who called us the first morning and provided us with brochures and suggestions - a nice touch. The beach is fabulous and we spent all our time out there, as it is just a few steps directly from the resort and it was easy to carry out beach stuff. We usually just hang at the pool area, but as the beach was very appealing and so easy to access, we actually preferred to spend our time there. We brought along beach towels, but the resort provided nice beach towels themselves, so we didn't even need to use ours. This was nice to have, especially if you forgot to bring them. And, just a couple of blocks down, is the ocean walk area, with a theater and restaurants. We ate at Sloppy Joes (which was good) and had a good time one night at the Mai Tai bar (very attractive place, and a happy hour starting at 9pm, as well as one in late afternoon). It had a great live band, which we really enjoyed. There is a Publix grocery store a couple of miles away, and we stocked up on breakfast, lunch and snack stuff, and just went out for dinner, which helped us to stay on budget. My husband was very happy to be able to use the free computers off the lobby to keep up with his sports stuff, and they also provide USA Today, so all around, lots of value for the resort. We clearly really found the resort and Daytona Beach to be lots of fun and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be going back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: robinbutler47
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay at your hotel and me and my wife are planning another trip just to stay in your lovely suites. The rooms were clean and the staff were very nice. The elevator were not slow there were no bad odors. We enjoyed our stay. The Butlers

Reviews.Title: “Would not be first choice to return”
Reviews.Author: JpRey1987
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews so I went into this rental a little skeptical. We were given a large condo (#601) at check in that was not ocean front. We had requested ocean front. The condo was large and clean however there was a musty smell in the living room as other travelers have noted. The living room view from this room was of the Wyndham Parking garage. You could see the ocean if you leaned over the rail and looked towards the East. The view from the bedroom was a little better but not much. Since this condo is in the front of the building there was street noise 24/7. A lot of sirens and motorcycles. The pool area was nice as well as the beach. The staff were very efficient and friendly. The only way I would return would be if I was guaranteed Ocean Front, I would never stay in a unit that was along the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: suzsmith40
Reviews.Content: Like many we have traveled to many different areas of the world and was reluctant on staying at this property based on all of the reviews we read. Trust me, we read them all! The price was so valuable we were willing to gamble and we are so glad that we did! Check in: Went very well. Our flight arrived early and our room wasn't available but we were given an access key to roam the property. Room: Our room was not ocean front as we had requested but it was ocean view (1007/1007A). I am not sure how you go about getting these as I was told there is only (9) available total. When we went up to our room housekeeping was cleaning an ocean front next to ours so we did wonder why we couldn't have been placed there as a family arrived after we did and received that room. Putting that aside... I will say our view was still great and the room was VERY clean and NO odors as others have mentioned. The place was extremely roomy and was stocked with everything you need for a vacation. The linens, kitchen accessories, pots/pans, blender, toaster, coffee maker. Full size refrig/stove in the main kitchen and half sized appliances in the second kitchen. It was every thing we needed and more. We even had a hot tub in our room and our own bathroom while the kids had their own separate room/bathroom which was fantastic! The place was fantastic for the value... seriously this 2 bedroom suite was amazing!! Pools: Inside pool is very small but it works for the little ones... hot tub is nice... Outside pool is not large but it certainly accommodated everyone. Please be mindful the pool slide is NOT for small children without supervision. My husband was not a big fan of the inability to "catch" your child at the end of the slide as the current was hard to work through. Kids love it but be cautious. Lounge chairs: Very nice chairs.. only complaint is the lack of umbrellas in this area. If you sat next to the bar you were fine but if one party wanted to lay out in the sun and the other wanted shade you had to separate... Gas grills: Located on the patio for your own personal usage.. Fantastic idea! Tiki bar: Good food and reasonably priced... Activities: This was great... for a very small fee your children could participate in activities.. kids loved it.. and they had things for adults too Beach: AWESOME.. AWESOME.. AWESOME! Very clean.. and we spent a lot of time here with the kids.. We did rent the umbrella/chairs from beach vendors just to get the umbrella. It's $30 a day but for us it was worth it as the kids wanted the sand/ocean but we had to have some shade too. Food vendors on the beach... Very clean/nice... but food is a little bit pricey... typical picnic foods.. burgers/fries/dogs/soda Safety: We felt VERY safe and never had any concerns in the property, on the beach, or walking the strip. We had (3) small children with us and never once felt insecure. Staff: Very friendly... always spoke and smiled at you! Job well done! Elevators.. It's true as most reviews read.. they are super slow and if your room is on the 10th floor like ours.. kind of hard to truck up 10 flights with 3 little peeps at toe but it wasn't horrible by any means. All in all this was a fantastic vacation and we would certainly go back without hesitation! Caution... it's obviously a hot spot for spring breakers... We arrived 3/30 and returned 4/7 and it was perfect because college season was "over".... We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs!! They will ruin the rest of your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: VIGIL48
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our room at 3pm on March 30, 2011. We had reserved and paid two months in advance for a 2 bedroom 2 Bath suite. When we checked into our room. It was only a one bedroom suite and did not have enough beds for the five of us. My 8 year old daughter had to sleep in two chairs putted together, and I had to sleeop on the pull out sofa bed with by daugther. My husband and step son sleep in the room with the king six bed. Next morning the moved us to the correct two bedroom suite. We walked in the room smelled odd, but look descent. We stayed the night. The next morning he had about 50 bed bug bites all over his body! WE will NEVER return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Room layout - nice, kitchen - nice, pool - fabulous but room could have been cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: KittyCrazy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a week at the Daytona Beach Regency and I was pleased with just about everything. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with a full kitchen, living room, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a jacuzzi. We also had a kitchen table right off the kitchen. Not that big but a nice touch. We had a flat panel big screen tv in the living room and a tv in each of the bedrooms. The room was very nice. Had all good updated appliances and cookware. The only negative was the room could have been cleaner. The bathtubs looked they had barely been cleaned. The hallways had a smell to them. Also the elevator was very slow. But the pool area was my favorite part. It had a very large pool area right on the beach that included a tikki bar and grill area along with a large pool with a water slide. During the day they had activities like, hula hoop contests, volleyball games, swimming races, contests, etc. There was also a DJ that played from like 1-4 several days while we were there. Kinda nice atmosphere while you are lounging by the pool. Also it was nice to have a security staff there guarding the grounds. Very nice guys. Overall I think I would stay there again. Just maybe bring me a bottle of Scrubbing Bubbles with me.

Reviews.Title: “old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Cristiana-L
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the receptionist mentioned that we might not have wifi in our room and we didn't. The next day another receptionist told us that they are having problems with the wifi on one side of the building and they just ordered the parts. Good...so no wifi in the room for this vacation...Another issue was the pigeons and the pigeons sh-- on our balcony. We didn't address this issue, considering that the maintenance staff was supposed to clean the balcony as well not just the room. The table and the chairs were all covered in sh--...great; so we couldn't use the balcony, either. With all this, we still tried to enjoy our vacation and what I called "my million dollar view" - the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MRudman74
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay for 2 nights beginning on our anniversary of Dec. 30th, and planned to celebrate New Year's Eve at the Boardwalk Pier to see the fireworks display. We booked a 1 bdr suite through bookit.com, and upon arrival (1 hour early) we were pleasantly surprised to find we had been upgraded to a 2 bdr lockout suite. This place was huge!!!! It was probably even cleaner than we left our apartment. The Master had a jacuzzi tub in it (which all four of us had a turn to enjoy) with a separate bathroom that had a walk in shower. Usually when we go to Daytona we end up leaving some kitchen essential or bathroom essential behind and have to run to the store, but not here. They had everything except toothpaste, toothbrush, and floss. Also, it had a fully stocked (dishes & towels) kitchen for cooking. We were all amazed at the quality of the bedding, towels, appliances (Cuisinart). The furniture was even better than what we own. Every room had an alarm clock with an iPod dock built in. This impressed our children to say the least. We only left the resort in the car one time, when we had dinner on the Halifax Marina. Otherwise everything including the famous "Oceanwalk Shoppes" was within comfortable walking distance. The pools were heated. The tiki bar out by the pool had reasonably priced drinks. I can not even begin to make you understand how nice and friendly the front desk staff was, especially Diane. They are there to say "yes" and make your stay a memorable one. We go to Daytona a lot, and Daytona Beach Regency will always be our 1st choice of a "home away from home"!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Conner2dood
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Regency after many weeks in Daytona. If you can get a good rate, it has ideal facilities, a location in middle of beach area, close to restaurants and shops. One bedroom apartments are specious and well furnished with complete kitchen and weekly serevice. Pool area is perfect for adults and childre, I find the straff to always be pleasant and eager to please. Only downsides are no great view from your balcony as south side has a tall building adjacant to you and northside, while having a view, it's of several run down properties. Garage is very tight for non-compact cars. Be careful of rooms which cannot receive the wifi due to their location...make sure you specify this if it's important to you. The hotel is very clean, beds are comfy and all you need to be at home in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “I'd love to go back”
Reviews.Author: shenvalleyrider
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very spacious and the staff friendly. It's right on the beach, has a great Tiki Bar on the premises and is within walking distance of good food, a movie theater and some shopping. There are other bigger, fancier hotels around, but this one suited us perfectly. I rated sleep quality a little low because A1A (Atlantic Ave) runs right by the hotel. Harleys rev up and down the strip at all hours. The hotel can't control rude harley people.

Reviews.Title: “Scary experience in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Vaca1Mizzou
Reviews.Content: This property is so old and outdated. The rooms smelled like mildew and my wife was sickened by the condoms left in the bathroom. Tiny roaches everywhere. Subpar resort. Diamond Maintenance fees are so high but for what?

Reviews.Title: “Ehh...okay, not what it used to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: jwrembert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Regency (October 23-24) to attend a relative's birthday party. The hotel has appeared to go down on the deep end since our previous stay. Upon checking in (or actually prior to) a panhandler was outside (clearly inebriated) trying to get money from my husband. The maintenance staff person saw this and motioned him away while he grabbed his walkie talkie radio and relayed what was going on to someone. The lobby decor was a lil' too busy for my taste. We stayed in room 404/404A. The hallway was somewhat hot. The doors on several on the hotel room were in need of a MAJOR paint job!!! The room was clean, although we had no washcloths and when this was mentioned to the front desk, it took then 30 mins or more to bring them because they were short-staffed. Also, check-out is 10AM. Most hotels are now giving you until 11 or Noon. The pool deck outside made up for the downfalls. It was nice to go out there and just relax..taking in the ocean breeze and listening to the waves! All in all, experience wasn't that great...price would determine whether we'd book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Regency”
Reviews.Author: CWROcala
Reviews.Content: We stayed about 45 minutes and only due to I was on the phone raising cane about the photo's vs accomodations and that the room smelled like an old bar. The smoke was unbearable & I smoke. I am not a chain smoker and I do not smoke in my home for this very reason. But I was told on Monday October 4, 2010 that I would be receiving a room on the ocean side of the resort I had two condo's booked and we were there for a wedding. Absolute largest mistake ever. We have friends staying next door at the Wyndham wonderful property and staff. We ended up booking for the exact same price at The Shores OMG what a difference in day and night. Note: that you do not want this experience on any level. Not to mention I booked, I went to the room to find the accomodations not clean, smelled of a chain smoker or several smokers in one small space and my entire party left and stayed at a 4 1/2 star resort for the same price... Please DO NOT MAKE the Same Mistake.... If you are going to stay in Daytona Beach best bang for the Buck on the North End would be either the Wyndham or The Plaza Resorts. On the South End hands Down The Shores Resort.... Stay Away from Daytona Beach Regency... The accomodations Terrible the Staff Excluding the Maintenance person was as bad as the Resort... This needs not to be confused as a resort it is a old run down hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family atmosphere, staff very attentive.”
Reviews.Author: Beachgoer62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Regency for Labor Day week. The staff was very attentive and responded to all our needs. This is a very nice small family atmosphere Hotel. The 2 bedroom lock-out was very nice but the only problem was the pigeons on the balcony. We had to have the maintenance guy come and clean the chairs and floor. The pigeons were still frequent visitors during the week, I was told by others in the area this was a problem for all the hotels in the area. Too bad because I love to sit on the balcony, we were on the North side of the building and had a wonderful view of the beach and Atlantic Ave. from the bedrooms and balcony but the feathers and poop made me shy away from the balcony. All in all I would go again, it was a very nice relaxed place.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: buffy333Florida
Reviews.Content: Customer service is great, great location and plenty of activities. ☺Only problem, which is a big thing for me; the floors were not clean: carpet and tiles.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION EVER......THAT'S WHAT THE KIDS ARE SAYING!!”
Reviews.Author: jaysgirl1128
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before but felt obliged to do so. We stayed for 2 nights with our 3 children (14, 8 and 4). Checked in on a Friday night. Check in was fast and friendly. Loved that there was a parking garage with key card access. Kids couldnt wait to get to the pool and that water slide! Tiki bar located poolside was perfect. Kids had what they wanted and so did my husband and I. Room was nicely decorated and very clean. Requested an extra blanket that night and it was (no lie) brought up within 5 minutes. We couldnt have asked for a better little end of summer getaway with our kids. Hotel is centrally located to anything you need! Thanks for a great weekend :)

Reviews.Title: “The greatest time ever”
Reviews.Author: JeffTampa
Reviews.Content: We spent the week and it was great. Service was great we had a small issue and security and staff were right on it, They were great. The pool and Tiki bar are outstanding. Rooms are very clean and well stocked. This is a must stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “As Always, Just Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: rags5930
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Daytona Beach (our favorite place!) for the week of the 4th of July - once again, we stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency (our 14th year there!) - and, once again, it was absolutely wonderful! Check-in was a breeze, with Sue helping us out - my reservation was just as expected, with Jenny Lou putting us in a wonderful ocean front two bedroom unit on the 9th floor. When we got to the room, it was very clean, well stocked, and smelled wonderfully - none of that musty smell that you get with some condos at the beach. The rooms are huge, also - no tiny condo rooms here. The balcony was very clean, too - no pigeon poop, as we have had on previous visits (and I know that can't really be helped, but it looked like they cleaned the balcony floors regularaly). My youngest daughter slept on the queen size pull-out couch, and that first night, when we called and asked for an additional blanket, it was delivered in less than 5 minutes! We always had plenty of towels, soap, kitchen commodities, and everything else we needed. And the beds - well, they slept wonderfully - it was just like being at home - my back never hurt at all!! The Tiki Bar was fabulous - you just have to try the Malibu Carribbean Punch - it's delicious! The pool area always has plenty of chairs, and they have two grills that are ready to use at all times - plus, you can go right down the steps from the pool, and you are on the beautiful beaches of Daytona! We walked to the Pier area, all of the Ocean Walk shops, Daytona Lagoon, and the bars over off of Seabreeze - the Regency has one of the best locations in Daytona! The only thing that was negative, was that the week just flew by much too quickly!!

Reviews.Title: “A Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: giggity_10
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went to the Dayton beach Reagen. the staff was very nice and the Pool And the ocean was great. we stayed on the 10th floor are suit ad 1 queen bed and a pull out couch. plus we had a flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: judybear49
Reviews.Content: I booked the room and when I drove up to the condo I wanted to cry because it looked old and in need of outside repair. But when I got inside I was really surprised. Lobby was very nice and check in was quick and simple...then on to the condo. Even being older they were very nice and clean...with new appliances. Bath could be updated but whose couldn't. Whenever we asked for anything like additionals towels they were in the condo before we were out the door. The best part is the beach was right there and we could walk the beach and stop and have drinks or food without having to move the car. I would stay there again. Food tip...eat at Sloppy Joes......well worth it ....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: brisket_lover
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our trip here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When you first get in grab a map and look for Jimmy. He will give you the run down of the area and some great restaurant advice. Grab a Voodoo from the Tiki bar and enjoy the pool area. Step out of the gate and enjoy the beautiful beach. The water slide, the bbq grils, the view, the beach, and the ocean all make for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Southeasternchic
Reviews.Content: We arrived a couple of hours before check-in and the front desk was extremely accommodating. Our room wasn't ready yet so they took our cell number and called as soon as it was. The place is older but right in the midst of everything and we were pleased with the very clean suite. Outside they have a tiki bar with outragious drinks. We had several family members with us and had a barbeque outside as they have professional size grills. The outdoor pool has a slide and kids really enjoyed it. They also have an exercise and game room along with an indoor pool, as well. For the price, it was certainly nice and I would definitely stay there again, if in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal...”
Reviews.Author: TwoSleepyPups
Reviews.Content: Our family has a time share based in St. John, but we are able to transfer weeks to other complying hotels. We stayed for a week at the Regency, and it was okay. The lobby is nice - and towels are readily available, which is nice. The elevators are somewhat slow, especially on check out day (usually Sunday for timesharers) so plan ahead.. we had to wait 15 mins for an elevator from the 8th floor! The hotel is beachfront, which is a plus. It also has a "tiki" bar and grill - although the food is all fried and not very good quality. The deck is well maintained with plenty of chairs to lay out on. Also, the pool and spa are refreshing, and there is even a water slide for kids. One night during our stay there was even live music outside by the pool, which was kind of fun. The typical crowd we noticed at the hotel was mixed -- some young couples, lots of families with kids, a bit of older people too. Our room was on the 8th floor - the carpets in the hallway were clean and overall there wasn't a smell (in some hotels this can be horrific!) I was somewhat disappointed that our room only slept 2 people. In the other hotels we have been to where the timeshare is accepted, its usually 4. Instead we had a garden tub in the bedroom area, which was somewhat odd. The room overall was clean - the kitchenette was well equipped with appliances, sample soaps, dish towels, a coffee maker, plates, utensils, etc etc. The bathroom was large and the shower was nice - very powerful water stream, always a plus. The bed was comfy. The TV was somewhat disappointing -- typical tube TV but had spotty sound. Our view was also nice. We were on the side of the building but could still see the ocean. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Just beware - Daytona itself isn't what it used to be. A lot of the shoppes on A1A (Beach front) are closed down. The crowd past dark is sketchy and my boyfriend and I felt a little uncomfortable walking around at night. Beach Street, the supposed historic district, is really nothing more than a river-front ghost town - only a few "antique" stores that house mostly people's old junk. Really the only thing to do is sit on the beach or eat at the restaurants at Ocean Walk. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: heatherbeeee
Reviews.Content: We had rented the 2 bedroom lock-off unit for 2 nights and it was absolutely fantastic! We had a great view from the 10th floor looking out out the water and the city, too. We had everything we needed as far as appliances and the beds were super comfy. The big jacuzzi tub is a nice touch, too. Very roomy and clean with a friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money for what you get”
Reviews.Author: mnc51
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents for 1 week and never had any problems whatsoever. The hotel is a bit dated, but most of the condo units are very nice. We stayed on the 8th floor in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo and it was awesome. The hotel is right on the beach...walk right out the back by the pool and down to it. Located on A1A and practically right across the street from IHOP and a convenience store called Kangaroo. All you need to do is buy some groceries and stock the kitchen and your set. Also, check out Bubba Gump's Shrimp Co restaurant. It's a short walk from the hotel and well worth the money. I'll definitely come back to this hotel. P.S.......it is a timeshare, but we were NEVER approached about buying at any time. Also, FREE WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect - it's not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: CAREFULLY2
Reviews.Content: When you walk in you think wow this is nice, but once you get to your "condo" you think.... Some of the "bad" places in mexico are beter than this!!! Would I recommend this to someone, ABSOLULEY NOT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I only slept here one night”
Reviews.Author: Azrea1
Reviews.Content: The lobby was decent if a little dated, and the woman at the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. However, as soon as I got out of the elevator on the second floor I smelled something unpleasant. It continued as we got to our room and into our room. I relate it to something between mildew and wet dog. I actually coughed a bit each time I came back to our room from outside. The room did not fair much better. The full kitchen was well equipped and very handy and the space was roomy if a little awkwardly designed. However the lighting was poor and resulted in dim lighting conditions no matter what we did except in the bathroom. The carpets were slightly damp all over for some reason I could not determine. Not wet really, but just enough to make your socks stick to your feet. There was a large LCD TV in the living room and the couches were decently comfortable. The bed was also decently comfortable. The bathrooms was a bit strange with only a stall shower that was as wide as full bath tub shower. The shower curtain that did not go all the way to the bottom of the stall and it was a cheap looking shower head that you can hold onto. The bathroom was almost too spacious and made me feel like there was wasted space in the room. The balconies were under closed due to maintenance, this is understandable, but the front desk person said we would have "great" views anyway. The view outside the living room was the A1A highway and outside the bedroom was the Wyndam hotel and maybe some beach if you looked at just the right angle. Parking is free which is nice, but otherwise I do not think I would stay here again. Stick with the Wyndam or the Hilton as they looked to be the only nice places around this area.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: meandclem
Reviews.Content: We were here for only 2 nights but the resort was very clean, friendly and had gorgeous views. We stayed in a Jr. Suite which was incredible. The balcony wrapped around to the side so you could stand overlooking the beach (with the beach breeze blowing), or you could walk around the corner and have a great view out of the wind. Either way, it was grand. The staff was SOOOO helpful and friendly, particularly Sue at the reception desk and Mike at the Tiki bar. Internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal I could have gotten (sams club package)”
Reviews.Author: orangeyeduck
Reviews.Content: Wow. for the price I paid Id say this was well worth the trip. I got the best room that wasnt overlooking the ocean. It was from end to end of the hotel so I had a balcony off the bedroom (better view than other side) and another off the living room. As seen in other reviews we couldnt go out on them, but the view was still nice. The room was clean and ready to go when we arrived (early check-in, around 1:30). the lady at the desk got us in quickly and I was surprised. We got the keycards and drove down to the underground parking. It was biketoberfest, which i was a little worried about, but we ended up having a great weekend. The indoor pool was open, although the spa was not, and we enjoyed pool and airhockey in the game room. The beach is right there of course, and we enjoyed picking up seashells. The location is nice, although a few buildings around need to be removed *one is burnt down, the other is abandoned* Dont think I could ever pay the real cost of this place, because I just refuse to pay that much to go to FLA, but if I ever got another deal like this, Id jump on it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a WONDERFUL time with only a few minor complaints.”
Reviews.Author: 2ChrisTravels
Reviews.Content: We are owners with Diamond Resorts, so we booked this stay in conjunction with a Disney vacation. After reading a couple of bad reviews just days before our departure, I impulsively called the resort to ask for a room NOT on the side of the property adjacent to the vacant building...big mistake!!! Yes, the abandoned building is an eyesore, but it is small and hardly noticeable when taking in the beautiful sunny views of the shoreline all around it. Not the case on the other side of the building, where we stayed in a somewhat darker 2-bedroom unit that overlooked a "skyscraper." The room itself was clean, comfortable and well stocked, but our unit did have a funny odor which my husband decided was "cake batter deodorizer." Yeah, EW, but not a dealbreaker for us. The mattresses were awesome, but earlier review about the balconies being literally blanketed in pidgeon poop are completely true. Not a real problem, though, since we thoroughly enjoyed sitting on the beachside patio area. The staff never seemed at all put-out by our questions, concerns or requests, and our needs were always met promptly and courteously. The pool is sparkling, and my two kids (14 & 7) loved the slide. The ocean is the best feature about this property. We live just a few miles from a beach on Cape Cod, and somehow Daytona's powdery sand, warm water, and massive waves made us feel like we were experiencing something truly extraordinary. The Tiki Bar serves tasty food, great cocktails, and friendly service. A word about the Daytona area. It was dusk when we arrived, and the area felt a little "sketchy." This is definitely not Marco Island or Naples, but if you're not snobby about it, then you will have a wonderful stay. Clean/ comfortable accommodations, great dining, and awesome beaches are really the priority for us when we vacation and, overall, we were more than satisfied with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice, Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kelly76
Reviews.Content: Our room had a full kitchen, separate bedroom and couch with a pullout sofa bed. There was plenty of room for all 5 of us!
