Very clean and everything in the room was high quality (linens, dishes, tv etc.). The staff was friendly and the pool area was nice. The oceanfront rooms were unusable due to some crumbling balconies, but our oceanview room was fine. The hotel was older, but seemed to be recently remodeled. There were lots of restaurants and shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework before trading to this timeshare- the hotel and area are seedy at best”
Reviews.Author: VogueConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The property is old and weathered. It is next to an abandonded hotel, which is home to vegerants. The mini mall across the street burnded down on Labor Day and has not yet been grounded. Our room was redone(?), it was a lock-out room. Very small and dreary. Upon arrival we were not made aware of the housekeeping policies. If you want clean towels, you must call everyday. The room only gets cleaned once a wk and there is no daily making of the bed or tidying up. I would suggest that the manager of the property retrain his front desk service in customer service. I was trying to get resolution to a situation, talking to the rep - phone rang 2x she answered the phone took care of callers while ignoring me. I would have told this to the manager if he had returned my call. I left a message with desk rep on Sept 14th - we left yesterday the 19th and no call back. Also asked for a room change - never ocurred. We asked, on our first day there, at the Tiki Bar what she would suggest doing/seeing while in Daytona, the reply was not what we expected - she said Daytona is the armpit of Fl - not much to do. We also called Interval to change hotels - it took 2+ hours and no satisfactory resolution. Security is everywhere on the property, that was somewhat reassuring.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: keeneys0506
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my timeshare to stay at the Daytona Beach Regency and was I severly disappointed. It's very small. We got to our room and the smell that hit us when we opened the door was really bad. It stayed there all week. We tried everything to get rid of it. I reserved a two bedroom for six of us. The king size bed was in the 2nd bedroom and the queen size was in the lock-out room. The sleeper sofa was awful. After the 2nd night, my family ended up sleeping on the floor. The dishwasher was broke so that when you tried to load it, the top shelf would fall. They don't stock the room with any of the utensils that you really need. Who uses a potato masher these days? The shower stall in the hall bathroom was disgusting. It had mold and mildew all over it. Housekeeping told me that it's because the building is 40 years old and after awhile, it just don't come off. None of the Ocean Front rooms could use their balconies, because they were all being repaired. There are only two elevators and one got stuck in the parking garage. There is an abandoned building right next store that is an eye sore, especially for the patrons who had rooms on that side. Homeless people were sleeping in them. I will never return to this hotel and I will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! Looks Good In Photos. Not Good, Not Safe, Not Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vevin
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I am the hotel finder when it comes to our group. I spend weeks finding the right place for the right price. I read all the reviews, look at all the pics, make graphs, etc. I thought I had found the perfect place. BOY WAS I SO WRONG! I don't know what is wrong with the people who wrote all the other reviews! So we get there. Everything seems ok although the hotel looks pretty trashy next to the other (be it much more expensive) hotels. We walk in and it looks like all the pictures, but much smaller than expected. Still ok. Went up to the 2 room lock off suite and although the furnishings are like the pictures, the floor plan is not. Both rooms did not have a private bathroom. One did, the other was across a hallway (not much privacy). Ok, here is the bad stuff... One, there is an abandoned building next door and it is filled with homeless individuals. We decided to walk back to the hotel on the beach at about 3:00am from the bar. We walked up to the hotel from the beach and they had these huge chain locks on the gate (strange we thought until we found out why). So we began to walk around to the front when 2 guys asked us if we wanted anything illegal. We said no thanks and started to walk away when they started making comments about what they would like to "do" to me... Well there were 4 of us (2 guys, 2 girls) and we are not ones to ignore things like that, so my husband inquired about what they said... Next thing we knew, they were coming over the wall, up from the beach, around from behind us. All together there were about 12 of them. Although we like to fight, we were out numbered. After a few blows, we did get away and into the hotel. The next morning we asked the front desk about the building and the chain locks. We were told that they have been trying to get it torn down for years with no luck and "DO NOT TAKE YOUR WOMEN ON THE BEACH AFTER 1:00am around it". WTF, seriously!!!!! Two, the place was really dirty and I am not the picky clean freak. We stay in A LOT of hotels (like 2 a month) and this was by far the worst as far as cleanliness that I have ever seen. Really disappointing. The whirlpool bathtub looked clean so I filled it, got in and turned it on (bad idea). All this gunk came out of the jets, but I didn't notice until I turned them off. YUCK!! There was hair on floors, balcony looked like it was never cleaned, furniture was stained. Everyone kept making comments on the smell in the hallway (smelt like mildew). The smell in our room was worse though. Mildew, Mold, dirty sock smell. Bad. Three, they charge for EVERYTHING! You want coffee? $.75 per pack. Oh, you want cream and suger packs, $$ Forget a razor $$, make a call $$. Plus they only clean your room once a week. So if you are there for a weekend dont expect any service and they only leave 2 towels per room!!! Overall, this was the worst choice ever. There are so many more hotels in this area that are soooo much better, pay the little extra it will be worth it! I would say that the only good things about this hotel was the tiki bar (very cool) although there is another hotel bar just south of the peir that is much cooler!! Sorry I dont remember the hotel name. And the kitchen in the room was nice. Thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Vacation EVER!”
Reviews.Author: beachbummm33
Reviews.Content: My children and I recently visited the resort and it was amazing! This has to be the greatest vacation EVER!! We were treated like royalty and the manger, Thomas was an angel! I was most impressed by the level of customer service we received from the front desk to the general manager going out of his way to interact with the guest. We travel often and have stayed at many resorts but this was by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “UNACCOMMODATING and DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: dalphoebe
Reviews.Content: We wanted to make reservations for an oceanfront room and were told the only way to do this was to reserve a 2 bdrm. We did, and when we got there we were told (1) that THEY choose the room when you get there and (2) all the oceanfront rooms with balconies were closed due to the storms (we stayed a week and it was sunny and beautiful every day). So, you could end up with a view of the alley that is on either side of the building that is smashed in between 2 buildings on either side of it and have a view of the dumpsters!! The rooms are dirty and the staff is rude. We ended up staying at the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference center OCEANFRONT with a balcony and had a WONDERFUL time!!! I would not stay here again and I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MNTrippers2009
Reviews.Content: We've traveled four and five star hotels in the US and Mexico but were visiting Florida for the first time and selected Daytona Beach. We were traveling with our 21 year old daughter, booked thru Expedia and were a bit leery of booking a timeshare property but needed a good price (who doesn't with the economy) and had an absolutely wonderful time. From Sue and Keiko and everyone at the front desk to Micheal, "Hot" Melissa (inside joke, nothing nasty), Danielle and Ashley at the pool bar, everyone (and everything) was fantastic !!! Chuck, the pool manager, made sure that all guests were well cared for. The drinks at the pool are outstanding and priced fairly. They offer daily food specials at the pool, including a pound of crab legs for about $13.00. We made it a point to seek out the GM before we left to tell him how much we enjoyed our stay. While the resort might show some (very) small signs of age, the room was clean and everything functioned without issue. Free parking, the location and access to beach are the real high points. Couples, families, large groups, everyone was there and seemed to have a great time. IHOP and the convenience store are within 2-3 minutes walking. Some good dining is within walking distance but a short drive (5-10 minutes) gets you LOTS of options. We'd stay here again without hesitation !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTLEY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: allankelly13
Reviews.Content: absolutley fab, the staff could not have been better lovely rooms clean spacious and quiet. Mr and Mrs kelly durham united kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jcolley10
Reviews.Content: We took 4 teenagers to Daytona Beach for a week and stayed at this hotel. It is one of the smaller hotels on the strip but a great hotel. I am very picky about where I will stay and loved this place. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath with a living room (sofa bed) and kitchen and this worked out great. Plenty of room, it even had a dining room table. It is a great location, you have plenty of shopping and places to eat within walking distance of this hotel. Parasailing, banana boat rides and food vendors are right on the beach. The tiki hut is also great for meals. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: dkp59
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about the resort. I only had 2 problems 1) The desk clerk named Judy when we was checking was rude. and 2)We didn't get an ocean front room lilke we was promise but the room we had had a fairly good view. They have a gas grill out on the pool deck that guest can use. We grill out everyday . They have so many activities for the children. the last day we was there The resort had a cookout. Plus the Tiki Bar out by the pool was the BEST. Try the drinks from there and they are not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you ask for, the staff provides with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: krich1966
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids stayed for one week amd were blown away with both the service provided and the wonderful pool overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. The staff was always quick to say yes to everything we asked for and the General Manager so concerned about our stay and always available! He even spent time painting the pool area, trimming palm trees and cleaning up the pool deck! Mandy at the front desk is a joy and if you have any problems with you reservation, ask for Jenny Lu... She know her business! They are installing a new indoor spa and making upgrades as I write this. If you have children, this is the place, a pool slide, gameroom and plenty of activities... We WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: PirateWench82
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency for my first Mothers Day. This resort was amazing. It wasnt an enormous hotel unlike some that are down there, but it wasnt so small that you felt cramped. We had a 2 bedroom Lockoff and it came with everything we needed. We did not have an ocean front room but all we had to do was walk onto our patio and look to the left and we saw the ocean and the pool deck area. My son loved the water slide and the pool. It was on the ocean so we could enjoy the water without getting all sandy. Like so many others have said in their reviews, the Voodoo juice is great, but just be prepared its literally in a bucket! Sue at the front desk was so friendly. We arrived a few hours early but we were able to get into our room and Check out was a breeze as well. We have definetly found a great place to stay whenever we take a weekend trip to Daytona!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vickishawn
Reviews.Content: The room was wonderful and the help at the desk was great. We were able to check in early . Although the room wasnt ready. They called us when it got ready. The view was great. When I return I will be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice oceanfront resort”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel999
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in different style units since September. This is a timeshare resort, making it slightly different from a hotel - meaning you don't get daily housekeeping unless you pay extra for it. This bothers some people, to me, I'd rather have a roomy condo with a kitchen over someone to make my bed every morning and change my towels. Housekeeping comes once during the middle of the week, the day depends on which floor you are on. The resort is small - 11 stories consisting of efficiencies, one br units and two br units. There is a secure underground parking garage, with an above aground area for larger SUV's. You need your room key to get in and out of the garage. The resort has 24 hr. security. Staff is very friendly. There are no ground floor units and approx. 22 ocean front units. Units on the North side of the building have very nice ocean views. Units on the South side of the building basically have a view of the Ocean Walk parking garage/or Ocean Walk balconies (there is approx. 25 ft. between the buildings. There is a small indoor pool and hot tub as well as a small game room andvery small fitness room with a treadmill and two or three other machines. There is a nice heated outdoor pool with a slide. The lounge chairs are very nice and cushioned. Towels are provided in your unit for the pool. There are two gas grills available to use as well as a Tikii bar and snack bar oceanfront next to the pool. You have direct beach access through a locked gate (you need your key card to get in and out). Many times, people leave the gate open. Not so smart, because then anyone can enter the area from the beach - especially at night. It is located next to the Oceanwalk resort on the section of the beach where cars are not allowed (love that). So the beach is very safe for little ones to play on without having to worry about getting run over by a motorized vehicle! It is a short walk to the pier and the boardwalk. There is a small waterpark with an arcade, mini golf and go carts across the street from Ocean Walk. Can't beat the location! In Sept. I had a 1 br unit on the 5th floor on the North side. The unit was very small, but clean. The kitchen was so tiny that when you opened the oven or dishwasher, it almost touched the other (they were opposite each other). The kitchen was stocked with liquid dish soap, paper towels and trash bags as well as coffee maker, dishes, sliverware, glasses, pots and pans, etc. The bathroom was good size and connected to the kitchen and the br. It had a garden tub/shower combo, one sink vanity and toilet. The bedroom was nice size with a very comfy king bed, upholstered chair as well as a tv. There was also an alarm clock, radio, docking station for your I pod. The bedding and linens were superior! The family room was tiny with a small table with chairs (sufficient for 2 people). 2 more people could eat at the counter/bar area. The couch (sleeper sofa) was leather and there was another chair. I did not find the couch to be that comfortable, but it would do. The TV was flat screen and there was a stereo. The balcony was tiny/narrow with two chairs. Not really good for anything because the pigeons take it over - usually full of pigeon doo-doo (you can call to have it cleaned). In November I stayed in a two BR lockoff on the 8th floor on the South side. Great unit - crappy view. It was a 1 Br and an efficiency together, but the layout of the 1 BR was better/larger. Pretty much the same kitchen - living area was slightly larger with two chairs instead of one. The bathroom was across the hall from the BR and had a shower only. The efficiency was beautiful and larger. The bed was king size and the jacuzzi was in the bedroom. The bathroom was nice with the sink, shower and toilet. There was a small kitchenette also. In January, I stayed in a 1 BR on the 10th floor street front. I would not recommend these units because the street noise is horrible (and I was there during off-season). It seems you can hear the traffic through the walls. Other than that, I loved the layout. The unit was the entire width of the building along the street, with a balcony on the north and south sides. What spectacular views, especially at night. You could see across the inter coastal waterway! Small kitchen with a separate alcove for a small table with 4 chairs. Nice size living room. Nice master bedroom and large bathroom with a garden tub/shower combo. Overall, I like coming to this resort. I come to Daytona Beach four or more times a year now, and this is my first choice to stay. It is clean, convenient, beachfront and spacious. I am a timeshare owner (although this is not my home resort) and always stay at a timeshare when I come to Daytona. In my opinion, most of the timeshare resorts are old, falling apart and outdated in Daytona - there are only a handful that I would stay in - this being my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: rosrog
Reviews.Content: we were at the regency from jan. 11th to 18th. check in was good we arrived early went for a walk got a voodoo juice at the tiki bar (YUM) and were called by 2pm that the room was ready it was a 1 bedroom/kitchen etc on the 8th floor. very good quality linens , very clean. the pool area/bbqs very good beach well it is daytona so very good the front desk staff was awesome. but and sorry there is a but . we booked thru interval as this resort was listed under the golf program so that's why we chose it unfortunately the activities lady couldn't be bothered supposedly II"S affiliation with the golf program says u get discounts etc , the activities lady said when asked there is a list of courses u can book yourself here are some #s i guess that was a help!!!!!!!!! other than her everything is good , location , restaurant availability, take a drive down the road to ormond beach to a place called Julians that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: wwslady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a week alone. We booked through our timeshare co. Diamond Resorts. Check-in was horrible, at least 20 families sitting or standing around the lobby waiting for housekeeping to release rooms. We were there early and got a key at 4;45 pm but we saw folks still waiting for keys at 6:00 pm. The two bedroom lockout we booked was nice. A king bed in the main section and a double in the lockoff. The living/dining area was smallish. Kitchen had new appliances and countertops.The batrooms were large and the lockoff had a large Jacuzzi bathtub in the bedroom.The only thing I disliked was the small, ugly balcony with cheap chairs; only good for smokers. The location is walking close to many restuarants and shops.A car ride will bring you to a grocery and many stores.It is a safe area to walk. Parking was free and secured.The Tiki bar had good food and drinks . Pool area had plenty of lounges and tables. We are going back in May with family.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was rubbish”
Reviews.Author: fitzthecatLutonBeds
Reviews.Content: during our stay balconys fell off it rained in side the rooms the carport fell down it was like faulty towers meets monty python it was so sad it was funny

Reviews.Title: “wonderful bedroom views”
Reviews.Author: clemi48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency for 2 weeks. We had a great vacation. Check in was smooth and we were in our room on the 9th floor in no time. We had booked a one bedroom and this was quite adequate for the 2 of us. There was a balcony overlooking the beach and the same view from the bedroom, where you could lie in bed and watch the waves lapping the sand. It was so relaxing!!. The bed was very comfortable, and the lounge area had a comfortable sofa. There was no kettle in the kitchen, a necessity for us Brits who need their cups of tea, which we had brought from home, but a call to reception brought us one in a couple of minutes. In fact anything that we needed was provided speedily. The swimming pool and deck area were nice with new furniture. The Tiki bar was a definite plus. The various rum based cocktails went down very easily especially the Voodoo Juice!! Now to the negative. On our third day the outside hot tub broke down. We reported it to the reception staff and then went away for a couple of days expecting it to have been mended by the time we returned. No such luck. My husband finds that the heat and the bubbles really help his knees and back and he was upset that this facility was not available. Just to sit in a hot tub without the bubbles is like sitting in a bath and does not help at all. On the Friday the duty manager was asked by my husband when it would be working again and he said that on Monday it should be done. He took our room number and we supposed that he would contact us. We heard nothing. In the end we had to really hassle the guy and eventually it was mended on the Thursday after watching the maintenance guy trying so hard to mend it and getting an electric shock in the process. If only Lon, the duty manager, had bothered to leave a message to say that there were problems with the repair then he would have saved himself so much hassle. Communication is all. Other problems were that there is great emphasis put on wearing a band to show that you are staying at the property, but the gates to the beach or the car lot do not always lock after someone has gone out and so anyone can walk in. They are sensibly very hot on getting everyone out of the pool area when the summer thunderstorms are nearby. It was lovely to be able to walk ndown the beach each morning and the heat is not so bad here as there are lovely sea breezes. All in all a very good vacation and we would come back again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TeresaBrandon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one time before and also had problems. The first time I booked through Orbitz. When we got to the hotel they told us that we did not have any reservations for us. Apparently someone had fouled up and booked us for the Sunterra in Orlando. So that was an ordeal and a half. We sat in the lobby for several hours waiting for them to get it starightened out. They even talked with Orbitz and they also confirmed it was for Daytona. There was a very snotty girl at the front desk and I overheard her say that my husband and I were trying to get a free room. That was very rude and I wanted to smack her so bad. But I kept my cool. :-) . Well throuhout that week it wasn't too bad. We found a roach in the kitchen which wasn't a good thing. So I decided to give them a second chance. Big mistake. The second room was a 2 bedroom suite. One cabinet corner was tore up. In our bedroom right above the whirlpool tub it was leaking. At times almost a complete downpour. Which was really annoying when trying to sleep. They had a guy come look at it but that was it. I was not impressed with front desk and they came off very snotty to me. When leaving I made all these complaints to the manager and he blew me off and didn 't even try to give us some money back or a few free nights. Something to help business. He was a real jerk. I would not recommend this to anyone. Someone shouldn't have problems with the same hotel everytime they go. Something is defintely not right at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Regent at all STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveler69
Reviews.Content: After having reservations for over 3 months for a 2 bedroom suite, we got there and they told us that they overbook and do not have a room for us and that was a day after they called and asked if we needed anything when we got there. No appology, just a letter to another hotel they booked us at. They did offer to pay for one night at the hotel they chose, but the hotel was 3.5 miles north, not even in Daytona Beach. We chose this hotel because it was close to the pier. We got a room at the Plaza next door, nice and comfortable, very friendly staff. We met 4 other couples that the Regency screwed. If you book, it's a fifty-fifty chance you'll get a room STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Awesome Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: aprilm26
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Daytona Beach Regency today after staying 7 days and 6 nights. Let me just say that this vacation was so much fun with a mix of relaxing, sightseeing and hanging at the bar. I was able to find a great deal on this resort through Ebay and booked it for a long awaited vacation for just me and my husband. The hotel staff was very friendly. The suite was exactly what I would expect - we had a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen, two baths, living and dining area, and ocean view. Our suite faced the Ocean Walk next door but that wasn't a problem. We still had a very nice view of the beach from the side. The pool area was the perfect size, and the water slide was tons of fun! I enjoyed many days laying out by the pool, reading a book or listening to music. The only problem with the pool was that the water was a little chilly - it's not heated. The indoor pool is not heated either, but I never ventured into that pool outside of sticking a foot in it. The other problem with the pool area was the construction going on, and the lack of use of the Tiki Bar area. I was really looking forward to hanging out in this area as I researched the resort to prepare for the trip. However, when we got to the resort we found the Tiki Bar closed. Luckily, construction only went on just two days while we were there. That made for the pool area to to be but so relaxing, but I just put my earbuds in and listened to music on my shuffle. The beach area was beautiful! The resort is very conveniently located within just blocks of the Ocean Walk Shoppes, the pier, a water park, dining and shopping. I really enjoyed walking to shops and eateries. My husband and I especially liked Bubba Gumps and the Mai Tai Bar - both of which are just a couple blocks away. We did have to attend a timeshare presentation one of the days at the resort. That was a little weird. We were originally told the meeting would be Wednesday morning, but when we checked in we had to change it. We picked Friday at 9 a.m., but that morning at 8:30 a.m. they wanted to switch our time to 11 a.m. I wasn't too thrilled about that time because it ate into my sunning time. Then we met our lady and she wasn't prepared for us. She thought my husband and I were owners and seemed a little flustered when we told her we weren't. We had a hard time getting information out of her about Diamond's timeshare system. When she presented us with the cost, and my husband and I weren't even sure what we would get with the points they wanted us to buy we said no thanks. They tried to offer us a different package but we were ready to get out of there. It was pretty much a waste of time. But it was just 90 minutes, no longer. Overall, I REALLY enjoyed our stay at the Daytona Beach Regency and I would go back (just never buy the timeshare!). My husband and I couldn't have asked for a better vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LCole18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 5 -11,2008. Very nice rooms. Directly on the beach where there is no driving which was nice to not have to worry about that with our kids. Pool was very nice and warm and our kids loved the water slide. Not too crowded which was nice also. Our room was in good shape and not outdated. Location of resort is in walking distance to many shops and restraunts. This was our first trip to Daytona and this resort and when we return we will definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Week.”
Reviews.Author: wweenie
Reviews.Content: We are 2 experienced Sunterra T.S. owners who traded for a week at this Resort. Feb 1 thru Feb 8. In the Time share world we have found Sunterra properties tend to be a more reliable choice. Excellent view and right on the beach. Single bedroom unit was spacious and clean but showed its age. Kitchen adaquate ,Plenty of towels for everything. Staff friendly and helpfull especially the concierge desk. The sales presentation, is what it is,but can be an informative 90 minute experience( with a gift at the end ). It is an update on Time Shares matters if you are an owner. Next week is the Daytona 500 great location for racing fans (we got out just in time!) W&B Werner Merchantville,N.J.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: GTAHouses
Reviews.Content: The Regency was more than we expected. All the staff was very nice and helpful. The place was very clean. We had some bird droppings on your two balconies but they were cleaned without hesitation and we could call them again if needed. We had a one bedroom with a north and south view on the city side. We loved it because the bedroom was on one side and the living is on the other. Kids slept and were not disturbed with the TV or talking. There was a DVD/VCR player for the 32" plasma in the living room as well as a cd and tape stereo. The kitchen cutlery and dishes were newer and very clean. We needed a cookie tray and they had it at our door in the time it took us to take the elevator to the seventh floor from the front desk. Very good service! Request a north view so that you don't face the Wyndham Ocean Walk (see pictures). The king size bed was very comfortable and the washroom was huge and very clean. The location is great. The indoor pool is small but the outdoor was heated so we spent most of our time outside. There is not too much to do in Daytona Beach so we spent time at the Manatee festival, Rolex 24 hours at Daytona, Ponce Inlet and walking the boardwalk. The beach was great and the sand was amazing. We have very little seaweed and no rocks. Cocoa beach was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: atwoodnca
Reviews.Content: This is actually called Sunterra Daytona Regency now, We exchanged through Interval International. We stayed in the 2 bedroom unit. One room had a king and the other a double bed.Everything is our unit looked newer and in good shape. The staff was very helpful, friendly and wanted to please. We were there in December. The outside pool was not heated but the repair was scheduled for Jan 2008, they also plan to replace outside furniture and paint the deck this winter. The parking is gated under the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “On the Beach for Thanksgiving! Gorgeous Room! What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: lprstn
Reviews.Content: Loved it!! Loved it! Loved it! I was small and cozy compared to the bustling resort next door, but we had the place pretty much at peace and not to crowded. The room was huge for a 1 bedroom and we all fit (5 of us) and we had 2 balcony's with a partial ocean view and a view of the street. During Thanksgiving week old time cars drive up and down the mainstreet and we could see it from our balcony. As well as the beach was right there...what else could you want? I guess maid service. You don't get maid service here...this is a timeshare resort. However, you also in walking distance to the mall. You have 1 outdoor pool and 1 indoor pool. We roasted marshmellows at the fire pit. The outdoor pool was not heated (that was a dissappointment), so we mainly used the indoor pool. This time of year is called "Red Tide" so some people may experience couphing, runny nose and tearing eyes..but none of us experienced it and my son has asthma...

Reviews.Title: “Ripped me off”
Reviews.Author: kinglibrary
Reviews.Content: When I checked into my room, there was a burn mark in the carpet. This did not bother me very much, as I was planning on spending most of the time on the beach with my family. However, when I got home from my trip, I noticed an extra $575 charge on my credit card from the hotel. I called and talked to John Betros, the general manager, and he accused me of personally causing the burn mark in the carpet. He was extremely rude to me, and treated me like a criminal. He refused to even acknowledge the possibility that the burn was caused by a previous tenant, or a member of the hotel staff. He has refused to give me a refund. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Theft from Room”
Reviews.Author: GaryCost300
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there in August. I was on my honeymoon. The week was going good. The condos are big in size and very spacy. The light over the bathtub burned out a day before we left and I had to flick the circuit breaker at times to get the AC going in the room. The worst part was that our DIGITAL CAMERA WAS TAKEN FROM OUR ROOM during our stay. It was taken anywhere from the last night we were there (8-12-07) until about 2pm the day we left (8-13-07) I know this camera was taken by someone with access to the room seeing that the doors lock automatically when they shut and I personally always check the door when I leave. I remember clearly that the camera was in the living room next to the couch. This is the story of my missing camera. We spent Sunday (8-12-07) next to the pool. I remember I took some pictures of my wife going down the hotel slide at approximately 5pm and not more than 5 minutes later we decided to go back to our room. My wife was feeling a little under the weather ( too much sun) so she layed down on the bed and I sat on the living area couch where I was reviewing our pictures of the week and thinking of how much fun we had. Shortly after looking at the pictures. I placed the camera next to the couch. I then grabbed my wallet, left the hotel and went accross the street to the stores to pick up some post cards and a few souvineers. I then returned to the condo to see how my wife was feeling. She said whe was still feeling a little ill and sleepy so I decided I would go down to the tiki lounge for a little bit. My wife came down about an hour and a half later. Shortly after that we went back to the room and went to bed. Our check out was the next day. We left the room at approximately 0945hrs. We met our maid on the way to the front desk. She looked at us and asked us if we were leaving and we told her yes. She told us to come back and visit her soon. The hotel called us a taxi and we waited just outside the lobby with our luggage for about 1/2 hour until the taxi arrived. On the way to the Amtrak station I realized that I didn't pack the camera and asked my wife if she remembered packing it, she said she did not. At approximately 11am we got to the Amtrak station. We pulled our luggage out of the taxi's trunk and double checked to make sure the camera didn't fall out. We then opened our suitcases to see if the camera was in any of them. We emptied them and we found NO camera. I immediately called the front desk and told them I think I left my camera in the room and asked if they could send someone up to our room to check. I gave them my cell number and they said they would call me back in 15-20 min to let us know if they find anything. We were anxiously waiting for there call for close to an hour when I decided to call them back to get an update. They said they were in the process of getting the housekeepers to check the room and they will call us back in a little bit. I waited ANOTHER 35 MIN and got no call by this time I was a little bit irriated because all of our honeymoon pictures were on the camera. I called them back and they informed me that they had to get the security department to check the room. I waited another 15 minutes and then I decided to call them and inform them to send someone up to the room we stayed in to check for the camera right now. At this time they informed me that the housekeeping and the security checked the room and found no camera. They said they would call me if they find anything. I was irate because I knew the camera was in the room on the floor next to the couch. I told them to double check that area and after a little bit of an arguement they agreed to double check the area I mentioned (so they said). They said they would keep looking for the camera and call me if they find anything. Sometime hours later while on the train I noticed that I had a message. It was the hotel and they said that they couldn't find the camera and they did all they could I CAN'T FATHOM THE FACT THAT THE CAMERA WAS IN THE ROOM AND IT HAPPENED TO GROW LEGS AND WALK AWAY. The maid seemed friendly enough but asked us 3 or 4 times during the week when our last day was. I didn't think anything of it at that time but now that the camera was last seen the night before we left makes me suspicious. When I returned to Boston a day later I called the hotel and asked if the hotel manager was around. The receptionist said I just missed him and he just stepped out for a minute. I then asked if they found a camera in the lost and found and her attitude changed once she found out it was me calling. She didn't even check she just informed me that they did everything they could and there was nothing else possible. I asked her to have the manager call me. The next day the manager of the hotel called me. He informed me that they looked everywhere for the camera and couldn't find anything. I told him that I've been doing security work for 8 years and asked them if they checked the door readers to the room to see who went in there. I also asked him to check the cameras and see if you could find anything suscpicious. I told him that if they review the cameras he should have seen me coming into the hotel from the rear door with the camera around my neck on Sunday 8/12/07 at approximately 5pm and when I left for the stores through the front lobby without the camera around my neck at approximately 7pm. He then told me that he considered this case closed as of now and there is nothing else he could do. He said he can have security look at the cameras and let us know if they find anything. It's been 1 week and 1/2 and I haven't gotten a call yet. I will be reporting this further even though I don't care too much about the 150 dollar camera. It our HONEYMOON PICTURES THAT I MISS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: afm1229
Reviews.Content: My family and i just returned from a 8 day stay at the Daytona Beach Regency. We had some Sunterra Points about to expire, so we chose this hotel being it was in close driving range to TN for our 10 month old which is still too young for Disney. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The hotel was better than I had imagined. It is in a prime location next to the famous Boardwalk of Daytona Beach. Our room was absolutely beautiful. the decor was very new and modern-not like the old fashioned peach seashell decor that you see in most beach condos. We had a 1-bedroom on the 9th floor that had an amazing view. Yes, there is a condemmed hotel next door that was destroyed in the hurricane. However, while we were there they were fencing it of as if to tear it down really soon. The resort had a grat pool with a really cool waterslide. The beach access was awesome. the security was amazing with guards patrolling 24-7. There is a parking garage below the resort with a few spaces available for large vehicles at the entrance to the resort. If there wasn't one available, the security guard would make one available. Overall, the stay was amazing and we will be back. We liked it so much, we stayed an extra day. Also, we decide to sell our RCI property and purchased with Sunterra. Loved the Daytona Beach Regency!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!! Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: lisab21
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation in Daytona Beach, FL and we stayed at the Daytona Beach Regency. We had a great time. We were in Daytona Beach for the National Tumbling and Trampoline Competition @ the Ocean Center. One of the host hotels for the event was the Hilton, which is right across the street. Many other gym people stayed @ the Ocean Walk Resort, which is right next to the Hilton. I debated between those two hotels and read the reviews before I decided on the Daytona Beach Regency. Many of the reviews are accurate about the Ocean Walk. This property has 4000 units stacked on top of each other and there are not enough pool chairs and the elevators cannot keep up with the guests. I heard many complaints from other gym people. The Hilton is nice but it's just a room. You get so much more @ the Daytona Beach Regency. It is located right next to the Ocean Walk. It is has 11 floors and two elevators. We did not have to wait on elevators ever! It has a nice pool area. My kids loved the spiral slide into the pool. It was never soooo crowded that you couldn't find a chair. You need to wear wristbands so outsiders off the beach cannot come to your pool. Security patrolled the pool. The stairs to the beach has a gate with a combination that is given to you @ check in, again, to keep people who don't belong there out of your pool area. The outdoor hot tub was nice also. The indoor pool is small. There is also an indoor hot tub. That wasn't an issue since we spent all our time @ the outdoor pool or on the beach. The Tiki Bar is handy for drinks and food. The beach area for the Daytona Beach Regency is nice and you can walk easily down to the pier, which is just past the Hilton hotel. You can rent umbrellas from a truck that parks on the beach and sets up two lounger chairs and an umbrella. It is $25.00 per day and you keep it the whole day. He tags it with your name so no one can take it. You can also rent boogie boards and smaller folding lounge chairs from the Regency's front desk. The boogie boards were $2.00 per day or $8.00 for the week. Next door to the Regency is an old hotel that is in the process of being torn down. We heard that the property owners might make a park out of it but I find that hard to believe, it will be nice property once it's torn down. Housekeeping comes once a week if you want it. If you don’t, just tell them when the knock and they will give you fresh towels or kleenex or anything you need. There is shampoo and soap in the bathroom. The rooms......they were great! It was like staying in an apartment. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom. It was so worth the extra money we paid for the 2 bedroom. It was huge! We had 4 adults and 2 kids and we had plenty of room. It gave you some space since there was a TV in the living room and in each bedroom. The couch in the living room is a sofa bed. There is a full kitchen and everything you need in it. A full size fridge, stove, microwave, sink, dishwasher and kitchen table and chairs. The 2nd bedroom and bathroom can be shut off by a door. There is a mini kitchen in that room also. A small fridge and microwave with sink and stove. We did not have an ocean front, which was not a big deal. The ocean front rooms usually go to the owners. We got a call about attending a timeshare meeting. They offered to give each couple a $100 visa gift card and a 3 day/2night stay for a future stay. We went and it was on the 11th floor @ our hotel. You did not leave or go to another location anytime during the presentation. They showed you some of their remodeled penthouse apartments (which are beautiful) and gave you their whole timeshare points system spiel. It was interesting but we were not buying. We told them no and had no hassles. The presentation lasted 90 minutes and they stuck right to that timeframe. We left with gift card in hand and coupon for another stay and we have our choice between 9 different places to stay. It was worth it so if they call you to go, they are very flexible on times and days, pick one and go! No line for check in and the front desk staff was very friendly. The concierge was very nice also. They really are there to make you happy. Across the street are gift shops. There is the Starlight Diner, IHOP, Dominos, Napolis Italian food, Baskin Robins Ice Cream all close by. Papa Johns also delivers to your room. We walked to the Ocean Walk shops and there wasn't much there as far as shopping. There were restaurants and bars, ice cream and a few shops. My daughter got her hair braided in the "square ". There was an artist painting names with pictures which was so cool. If you walk a little bit further, there are arcade games and a huge bungee ball ride. On the beach, nearby the Regency, you can buy food from a vendor and they have everything. Cheesy fries, hamburgers, etc. Just a few feet away from that you can parasail, which we did that too. There is another ride that a jet ski takes on a long tube ride. The hotel was just in a great location. It looks so small sitting next to the Ocean Walk but let me tell you, bigger isn't always better. The lobby was beautiful. Gold leather chairs, chandeliers, a big bouquet of flowers in the center. There were vending machines in the hotel which sell food, ice cream and amenities like tide and bounce, a game room with arcade games, air hockey and pool table, 2 washer and dryers on each floor to use free of charge. There was a drink lounge that you passed on your way out to the pool. There was a small fitness room also. The amenities you get with this hotel are unbeatable. We were so happy our entire stay. If you have an event @ the Ocean Walk, it is just a short walk. Lots to look @ while walking. We shared a 12 passenger van with another group from the airport and it cost us 15.00 each. (30.00 total for the ride). I hope this information is helpful if you are trying to decide on a hotel in Daytona Beach. I give this place 5 stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful memories for our whole family of 8 - and no snow there!”
Reviews.Author: HERBEEZ
Reviews.Content: I type this after being back home in Vermont for a week - back in the land of clouds, snow, maple syrup and mud season. Our last family vacation was 10 yrs previous (also to Florida). The week we spent at the Daytona Beach Regency was so wonderful - I checked out reviews of the hotel ahead of time, and found someone so upset because of some pigeon droppings on the deck. So what! At least it's not ten inches of snow!! We won our week's stay at the hotel on Ebay. After two days of driving 700 miles, the girl at the service desk was so pleasant and nice. She was happy to meet her first person from Vermont, and had not ever experienced an air temperature cooler than 40F. Our 10 yr old daughter was stung by a jellyfish her first 20 minutes in the water - the manager was very helpful with vinegar and advice. We all spent much time in the very clean pool, and the kids all loved the waterslide! We went to a music concert just 5 minutes' walk away one evening - we met another family from the Daytona area that had five children - we now have some penpals and new friends! Even though it was a "spring break" week, it worked out very well for us - the college kids were out all night and we were out all day.... The cleaning lady came just often enough with clean towels, and was fun to talk to. We found our apartment to be just right for our family size, and very clean. We didn't use many kitchen dishes - we had brought some of our own - we didn't want to break anything. We all walked the beach about twice per day. The weather was perfect. The sand was beautiful except for all the jellyfish. The place felt just like our home for our week there. We even caught ourselves calling it home toward the end of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, friendly and a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gypsyduo
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for the pier, the boardwalk and the beach. The Regency provides first class accommodation on Daytona Beach within easy walking distance of some great music bars, American fast food restaurants and a super diner. The rooms are very spacious, well cared for with an excellent housekeeping service - lovely crispy towels and linen changed on a regular basis and very jolly staff. The pool is located next to the beach - great for kids of all ages with a nice big terrace and bar for snacks and drinks. There is also an indoor pool with a small gym Whilst furniture shows a little sign of age the rooms are very well equipped and the overall experience was of a very clean, well managed hotel striving to maintain high standards - we very much enjoyed our stay. The only negative aspect was pigeons - they like to congregate on the balconys which is a minor irritation - apparently thay are concidered an endangered species in this area - we have millions of the pesky things!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: 1purple
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Daytona Beach Regency during June 2006. We had a one bedroom ocean front unit. The unit was in ok condition. We had some slight problems with a balcony door that wouldn't close completely, elevators that didn't work and other issues that are common in beach properties. Some construction was on going but it wasn't a bother. Any time we had a problem the management responded quickly. We had easy beach access. There was a pool with a slide my kids enjoyed and lots of activities during the week including live bands. The resort seemed more geared towards adults and older groups than families. The staff was great and made every effort to make sure our stay was a good one. My family liked staying there but there were some issues that make us more likely to stay at another property next time.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: rx8
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from a six night stay. The hotel is a very nice property. The only issues we had were minor. The first is if you want to sit out in the morning on the pool deck be prepared to need to move or get wet from from the power washing they do each morning. Second the elevators seem to be over worked and not well coordinated, long waits and full cars when it arrived were a frequent problem. We did have some birds frequenting our balcony but no real bother. Over all its a great hotel in a great location, lot to do nearby and of course the beach is GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: pennstate1985
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. We started in a 1 bedroom(no 2 bedrooms available) and it was very roomy, We moved into a 2 bedroom after 2 days. This was a great room. Two big bedrooms, the second bedroom had a partial kitchen and a full bath. My teenager and his friends loved having their own "condo" The resort staff were very friendly and helpful. Lots of activities for those who wanted to be entertained throughout the day. The only bad thing about our stay was the construction next to the hotel. It was very loud and it started at 7 am (so no sleeping in). The hotel is right in the heart of everything so we walked to a lot of places. Our family would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Seizedday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days in March(Room 207). Rooms were beautiful and spacious. I was not able to get an overfront room but the oceanview room was suitable. Make sure you stop by the conceirge desk as they have great discounts on parasailing and food coupons. Whirlpool was great and very relaxing both day and night. Very nice girl at the front desk allowed us to check in a couple hours early because our room was already prepared. She was a gem. All I can remember about her is that her name started with an S. Everything was very clean and it was one of the nicest places that I have ever stayed. Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay in my life”
Reviews.Author: Seacrakker
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite in October, for a wedding we attended in Daytona Beach, at the end of December. We stipulated that we wanted ocean view, upper floor and a non-smoking room. I explained that we had a family member with asthma. The hotel rep. said those requests would be honored. The night we checked in, we were given a room on the 2nd floor. The room and the entire floor stunk of cigarette smoke. The room's balcony was up against the roof level of the parking garage. The garage roof was 3-4 feet higher than the balcony floor. Our view was of nothing but flat roof, and the balcony was enclosed, floor to ceiling, with steel bars, just like a jail cell! I immediately went down to the front desk and demanded the room we were promised. When I described the "hole" of a room we had been given, the desk clerk smirked and agreed to look for another room. I asked why we didn't get what we were promised. She said the good rooms go to the people who check in earliest during the day, and how early you reserve or what you are promised doesn't mean anything. I said I would pay extra to get the oceanfront room. She said there were none available. She gave us a different room. It was on the 5th floor, didn't smell of smoke, but had a view of the alley, a dumpster and the neighboring hotel's parking garage. The balcony was a nesting spot for pigeons and was covered with droppings. The room and windows were filthy. Two of the beds had no sheets on them, not enough pillows and missing blankets. The entire suite was smelly and musty, but we couldn't open the doors to the balcony, because their were no screens and the pigeons kept trying to walk inside! The door from the master bedroom to the balcony wouldn't latch, so they had a chain on the door. It would open an inch then slam as it swung back and forth in the wind. We stuck a shoe in the crack to stop the slamming and had to listen to the wind whistle all night long. As a side note, as I was leaving the front desk, after demanding a better room, a man walked in off the street and requested a 2 bedroom suite. The next day I saw him in the elevator and he remarked about his nice oceanfront view! We were only staying 3 nights and were busy with the wedding so decided not to fight another round with the front desk. When we checked out, the clerk tried to charge us $300.00 more than we owed, and had no record of our prepaid first night! Without a doubt this was the WORST hotel stay I've had in my life. The accommodations were disgusting and the hotel management was pitiful. Don't stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a hotel, beach AND location. . .”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles1619
Reviews.Content: After finishing up a cruise at Port Canaveral, 2 couples of us drove to Daytona, for one night, before leaving from the Sanford airport to go back to Illinois. This hotel is fabulous. We arrived early and were able to check in an hour early. Our suite and connecting room were just remodeled. One BR had a queen bed, jacuzzi tub in the BR, a small galley kitchen and a large bath with a huge shower. Since we booked a 2 BR, the connecting door was open to the suite. It had a huge BR with a king bed, access to the outside balcony, and another full bath with shower off the hallway. The kitchen, dining table and LR were large. There was new full size range, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator and a long counter top with chairs where people could eat. All 3 rooms (living and the 2 bedrooms) had floor to ceiling windows with beautiful views of the beach and of the city. The beach is fabulous, the pool (with a GREAT waterslide) and poolside bar were super. The location is one block from a small shopping, dining and movie area. They are still remodeling and we did hear workers during the day when we went out the front door but didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 4 adults and 2 children with us and stayed in the 2 bedroom suite in late July 05; we had a great time; the suite was wonderful; 3 tvs; comfortable beds and it was very clean. However, we were on the 2nd floor and our balcony was next to a dryer vent and it made it too hot to exjoy. That was our only complaint! The staff was very quick to respond when we requested extra towels and pillows. Also, I was pleasantly surprised when I found out that the washer and dryer were free. My kids loved the slide in the pool; it kept them busy for hours!!

HotelInfo.Name: Daytona Beach Regency
HotelInfo.Address: 400 North Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
